<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P><FONT SIZE=2>The weighted average exercise price for options granted in 1997 was $27.06, in 1998 was $27.38, in 1999 was $23.35 and in 2000 was $20.12. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
weighted average remaining contractual life for options outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2000 was 5&nbsp;years and the weighted average remaining contractual life for options exercisable at
December&nbsp;31, 2000 was 5&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company records options granted using Accounting Principles Board (APB) opinion Number 25, "Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees and Related Interpretations." Accordingly, no compensation </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>67</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=69,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=940781,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]FM1260B.;18',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fm1260_1_68"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
expense is recognized on the date the options are granted. If the Company had recorded compensation expense using the methodology prescribed in SFAS&nbsp;123, "Accounting for Stock-Based
Compensation," the Company's net income would have been reduced by approximately $471 or $0.01 per share for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2000, $488 or $0.01 per share for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 1999 and $228 or $0.00 per share for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 1998. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
weighted average fair value of options granted during 2000, 1999 and 1998 were $1.27, $0.98 and $2.01, respectively. The fair value of each option grant issued in 2000, 1999 and 1998 is estimated
at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the following weighted average assumptions: (a)&nbsp;dividend yield of 10.2% in 2000, 10% in 1999 and 7.8% in 1998,
(b)&nbsp;expected volatility of the Company's stock of 20.35% in 2000, 17.29% in 1999 and 17.26% in 1998, (c)&nbsp;a risk free interest rate based on U.S. Zero Coupon Bonds with time of maturity
approximately equal to the options' expected time to exercise and (d)&nbsp;expected option lives of five years for options granted in 2000, 1999 and 1998. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>14. Deferred Compensation Plans:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Company has established deferred compensation plans under which key executives of the Company may elect to defer receiving a portion of their cash
compensation otherwise payable in one calendar year until a later year. The Company may, as determined by the Board of Directors at its sole discretion, credit a participant's account with an amount
equal to a percentage of the participant's deferral. The Company contributed $387, $296 and $295 to the plans during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2000, 1999 and 1998, respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
addition, certain executives have split dollar life insurance agreements with the Company whereby the Company generally pays annual premiums on a life insurance policy in an amount equal to the
executives deferral under one of the Company's deferred compensation plans. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>15. Stock Repurchase Program:  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>On November&nbsp;10, 2000, the Company's Board of Directors approved a stock repurchase program of up to 3.4&nbsp;million shares of common stock. As of
December&nbsp;31, 2000, the Company repurchased 564,000 shares of its common stock at an average price of $19.02 per share. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>16. Cumulative Convertible Redeemable Preferred Stock:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On February&nbsp;25, 1998, the Company issued 3,627,131 shares of Series&nbsp;A cumulative convertible redeemable preferred stock ("Series&nbsp;A
Preferred Stock") for proceeds totaling $100,000 in a private placement. The preferred stock can be converted on a one for one basis into common stock and will pay a quarterly dividend equal to the
greater of $0.46 per share, or the dividend then payable on a share of common stock. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>68 </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=70,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=686869,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]FM1260B.;18',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fm1260_1_69"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
On June&nbsp;17, 1998, the Company issued 5,487,471 shares of Series&nbsp;B cumulative convertible redeemable preferred stock ("Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock") for proceeds totaling $150,000 in
a private placement. The preferred stock can be converted on a one for one basis into common stock and will pay a quarterly dividend equal to the greater of $0.46 per share, or the dividend then
payable on a share of common stock. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>No
dividends will be declared or paid on any class of common or other junior stock to the extent that dividends on Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock have not been
declared and/or paid. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
holders of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock have redemption rights if a change of control of the Company occurs, as defined under the respective Articles
Supplementary for each series. Under such circumstances, the holders of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock are entitled to require the Company to redeem their
shares, to the extent the Company has funds legally available therefor, at a price equal to 105% of their respective liquidation preference plus accrued and unpaid dividends. The Series&nbsp;A
Preferred Stock holder also has the right to require the Company to repurchase its shares if the Company fails to be taxed as a REIT for federal tax purposes at a price equal to 115% of its
liquidation preference plus accrued and unpaid dividends, to the extent funds are legally available therefor. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Although
the Company believes that the likelihood of redemption occurring is remote, it has revised its 1999 consolidated financial statements in accordance with the Securities and Exchange
Commission's Accounting Series Release No.&nbsp;268. As a result, the carrying value of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock as redeemable, which was previously
presented as a component of common stockholders' equity, has now been presented outside of common stockholders' equity as of December&nbsp;31, 1999. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
matter described above had no effect on the Company's net income, total assets or total liabilities. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company's previously reported redeemable preferred stock was at $0 at December&nbsp;31, 1999. After reflecting adjustments of $98,934 and $148,402 to present the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock
and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock as redeemable, the redeemable preferred stock, as revised, is $247,336 at December&nbsp;31, 1999. The Company's previously reported Minority Interest in Operating
Partnership was $157,599 at December&nbsp;31, 1999. In connection with the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock being presented outside of common stockholders' equity,
Minority Interest in Operating Partnership, as revised, is $129,295 at December&nbsp;31, 1999. The Company's previously reported common stockholders' equity was $620,286 at December&nbsp;31, 1999.
After reflecting adjustments of $98,934 and $148,402 to present the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock as redeemable and the related adjustment to Minority Interest in
Operating Partnership, the Company's common stockholders' equity, as revised, is $401,254 at December&nbsp;31, 1999. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>69</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_fm1260_1_70"> </A>

<TD WIDTH="25%"><FONT SIZE=2>Revenues</FONT></TD>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>For all quarterly balance sheet dates, an amount of $247,366 and approximately $31,000, previously presented in common stockholders' equity is now presented as redeemable
preferred stock and minority interest, respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>18. Segment Information:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>During 1998, the Company adopted SFAS No.&nbsp;131, "Disclosures about Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information." SFAS No.&nbsp;131 established
standards for disclosure about operating segments and related disclosures about products and services, geographic areas and major customers. The Company currently operates in one business segment, the
acquisition, ownership, redevelopment, management and leasing of regional and community shopping centers. Additionally, the Company operates in one geographic area, the United States. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>19. Subsequent Events:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On February&nbsp;13, 2001 a dividend/distribution of $0.53 per share was declared for common stockholders and OP Unit holders of record on February&nbsp;22,
2001. In addition, the Company declared a dividend of $0.53 on the Company's Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and a dividend of $0.53 on the Company's Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock. All
dividends/distributions will be payable on March&nbsp;7, 2001. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>70</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_fo1260_1_71"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Report of Independent Accountants  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>To the Board of Trustees and Stockholders of Pacific Premier Retail Trust: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
our opinion, the accompanying consolidated financial statements listed in the index appearing under Item 14(a)(1) on page 39 present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of
Pacific Premier Retail Trust (the "Trust") at December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2000 and for the period
from February&nbsp;18, 1999 (Inception) to December&nbsp;31, 1999 in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. In addition, in our opinion, the
financial statement schedule listed in the index appearing under Item 14(a)(4) on page 40 presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein when read in conjunction with the
related consolidated financial statements. These financial statements and financial statement schedule are the responsibility of the Trust's management; our responsibility is to express an opinion on
these financial statements and financial statement schedule based on our audits. We conducted our audits of these statements in accordance with auditing standards generally accepted in the United
States of America, which require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes
examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and
evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>As
discussed in Note&nbsp;2 to the consolidated financial statements, effective January&nbsp;1, 2000, the Trust adopted Staff Accounting Bulletin 101. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>PricewaterhouseCoopers
LLP<BR>
February&nbsp;13, 2001 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_fu1260_1_76"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>1. Organization and Basis of Presentation:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On February&nbsp;18, 1999, Macerich PPR Corp. (the "Corp"), an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of The Macerich Company (the "Company"), and Ontario Teachers'
Pension Plan Board ("Ontario Teachers"') acquired a portfolio of properties in the first of a two-phase acquisition and formed the Pacific Premier Retail Trust (the "Trust"). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
first phase of the acquisition consisted of three regional malls, the retail component of a mixed-use development and five contiguous properties comprising approximately
3.4&nbsp;million square feet for a total purchase price of approximately $415,000. The purchase price was funded with a $120,000 loan placed concurrently with the closing, $109,800 of debt from an
affiliate of the seller and $39,400 of assumed debt. The balance of the purchase price was paid in cash. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
second phase consisted of the acquisition of the office component of the mixed-use development for a purchase price of approximately $111,000. The purchase price was funded with a
$76,700 loan placed concurrently with the closing and the balance was paid in cash. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On
October&nbsp;26, 1999, 99% of the membership interests of Los Cerritos Center and Stonewood Mall and 100% of the membership interests of Lakewood Mall were contributed to the Trust. The total
value of the transaction was approximately $535,000. The properties were contributed to the Trust subject to existing debt of $322,000. The properties were recorded at approximately $453,100 to
reflect the cost basis of the assets contributed to the Trust. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Trust was organized to qualify as a real estate investment trust ("REIT") under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. The Corp maintains a 51% ownership interest in the Trust, while
Ontario Teachers' maintains a 49% ownership interest in the Trust. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
properties as of December&nbsp;31, 2000 and their locations are as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=78,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=974094,FOLIO='76',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]FU1260A.;12',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fu1260_1_77"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Cash and Cash Equivalents:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The Trust considers all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of 90&nbsp;days or less when purchased to be cash equivalents, for which cost approximates fair
value. Included in cash is restricted cash of $2,009 and $1,299 at December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999, respectively. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Tenant Receivables:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Included in tenant receivables are accrued overage rents of $2,630 and $2,835 and an allowance for doubtful accounts of $258 and $171 at December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999,
respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Revenues:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Minimum rental revenues are recognized on a straight-line basis over the terms of the related lease. The difference between the amount of rent due in a year and the
amount recorded as rental income is referred to as the "straight lining of rent adjustment." Rental income was increased by $3,306 and $2,501 in 2000 and 1999, respectively, due to the straight lining
of rents. Percentage rents are recognized on an accrual basis. Recoveries from tenants for real estate taxes, insurance and other shopping center operating expenses are recognized as revenues in the
period the applicable costs are incurred. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Property:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Costs related to the redevelopment, construction and improvement of properties are capitalized. Interest costs are capitalized until construction is substantially complete. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Expenditures
for maintenance and repairs are charged to operations as incurred. Realized gains and losses are recognized upon disposal or retirement of the related assets and are reflected in
earnings. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Property
is recorded at cost and is depreciated using a straight-line method over the estimated lives of the assets as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Building and improvements</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>5-39 years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant improvements</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>initial term of related lease</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Equipment and furnishings</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>5 years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Trust assesses whether there has been an impairment in the value of its long-lived assets by considering factors such as expected future operating income,
trends and prospects, as well as the effects of demand, competition and other economic factors. Such factors include the tenants' ability to perform their duties and pay rent under the terms of the
leases. The Trust may recognize an impairment loss if the income stream is not sufficient to cover its investments. Such a loss would be </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>77</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=79,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=729155,FOLIO='77',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]FU1260A.;12',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fu1260_1_78"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
determined as the difference between the carrying value and the fair value of a property. Management believes no such impairment has occurred in its net property carrying values at December&nbsp;31,
2000 and 1999. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Deferred Charges:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Costs relating to financing of properties and obtaining tenant leases are deferred and amortized over the initial term of the agreement. The straight-line method is
used to amortize all costs except financing, for which the effective interest method is used. The range of the terms of the agreements are as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Deferred lease costs</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>1-9 years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Deferred financing costs</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>1-12 years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Income taxes:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The Trust has elected to be taxed as a REIT under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. A REIT is generally not subject to income taxation on that portion of its
income that qualifies as REIT taxable income as long as it distributes at least 95% of its taxable income to its stockholders and complies with other requirements. Accordingly, no provision has been
made for income taxes in the financial statements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Accounting Pronouncements:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>In December&nbsp;1999, the Securities and Exchange Committee issued Staff Accounting Bulletin 101, "Revenue Recognition in Financial Statements" ("SAB 101"), which became
effective for periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 1999. This bulletin modified the timing of revenue recognition for percentage rent received from tenants. This change will defer recognition
of a significant amount of percentage rent for the first three calendar quarters into the fourth quarter. The Trust applied this change in accounting principle as of January&nbsp;1, 2000. The
cumulative effect of this change in accounting principle at the adoption date of January&nbsp;1, 2000, was approximately $397. If the Trust had recorded percentage rent using the methodology
prescribed in SAB 101, the Trust's net income would have been reduced by $397 for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 1999. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
June&nbsp;1998, FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standard ("SFAS") 133, "Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities," ("SFAS&nbsp;133") which requires companies
to record derivatives on the balance sheet, measured at fair value. Changes in the fair values of those derivatives will be accounted for depending on the use of the derivative and whether it
qualifies for hedge accounting. The key criterion for hedge accounting is that the hedging relationship must be highly effective in achieving offsetting changes in fair value or cash flows. In
June&nbsp;1999, the FASB issued SFAS&nbsp;137, "Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities," which delays the implementation of SFAS&nbsp;133 from January&nbsp;1, 2000 to
January&nbsp;1, 2001. In June&nbsp;2000, the FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;138, "Accounting for Certain Derivative Instruments and Certain Hedging Activities&#151;an </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>78</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=80,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=150101,FOLIO='78',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]FU1260B.;7',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:11' -->
<A NAME="page_fu1260_1_79"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Amendment of FASB Statement No.&nbsp;133," ("SFAS&nbsp;138") which amends the accounting and reporting standards of SFAS&nbsp;133. The Trust has determined the implementation of SFAS&nbsp;133
and SFAS&nbsp;138 will not have an impact on its consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Fair Value of Financial Instruments:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>To meet the reporting requirements of SFAS No.&nbsp;107, "Disclosures about Fair Value of Financial Instruments," the Trust calculates the fair value of financial
instruments
and includes this additional information in the notes to the consolidated financial statements when the fair value is different than the carrying value of those financial instruments. When the fair
value reasonably approximates the
carrying value, no additional disclosure is made. The estimated fair value amounts have been determined by the Trust using available market information and appropriate valuation methodologies.
However, considerable judgment is required in interpreting market data to develop the estimates of fair value. Accordingly, the estimates presented herein are not necessarily indicative of the amounts
that the Trust could realize in a current market exchange. The use of different market assumptions and/or estimation methodologies may have a material effect on the estimated fair value amounts. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Concentration of Risk:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The Trust maintains its cash accounts in a number of commercial banks. Accounts at these banks are guaranteed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation ("FDIC") up to $100.
At various times during the year, the Trust had deposits in excess of the FDIC insurance limit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>AT&amp;T
Wireless Services represented 12.8% and 9.5% of total minimum rents in place as of December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999, respectively; and no other tenant represented more than 3.8% and 2.7% of
total minimum rents as of December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Management Estimates:<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The preparation of financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP") requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect
the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the
reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>79</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2><I>(a)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> This represents the monthly payment of principal and interest.  </I></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2><I>(b)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> In connection with the acquisition of this
property, the Trust assumed $39,425 of debt. At acquisition, this debt was recorded at fair value of $41,475 which included an unamortized
premium of $2,050. This premium was being amortized as interest expense over the life of the loan using the effective interest method. The Trust's monthly debt service was $349 and was calculated
based on an 8.60% interest rate. At December&nbsp;31, 1999, the Trust's unamortized premium was $1,365. On June&nbsp;1, 2000, the Trust paid off in full the old debt and a new note was issued for
$61,000 bearing interest at a fixed rate of 8.06% and maturing June&nbsp;2010. The new loan is interest only until December&nbsp;31, 2001. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2002, monthly principal and
interest of $450 will be payable through maturity. The new debt is cross-collateralized by Kitsap Mall and Kitsap Place.  </I></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2><I>(c)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> In connection with the acquisition of this property,
the Trust assumed $127,000 of collateralized fixed rate notes (the "Notes"). The Notes bear interest at an average fixed rate of
7.20% and mature in August&nbsp;2005. The Notes require the Trust to deposit all cash flow from the property operations with a trustee to meet its obligations under the Notes. Cash in excess of the
required amount, as defined, is released. Included in cash and cash equivalents is $750 of restricted cash deposited with the trustee at December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999.  </I></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2><I>(d)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> On
July&nbsp;28, 2000, the Trust placed a $16,125 floating rate note on the property bearing interest at LIBOR plus 2.25% and maturing July&nbsp;2002. At December&nbsp;31,
2000, the total interest rate was 9.0%.  </I></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2><I>(e)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Concurrent with the acquisition of the property, the Trust placed $76,700 of debt and obtained a construction loan for an additional
$16,000. Principal is drawn on the construction
loan as costs are incurred. As of December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999, $15,038 and $6,745 of principal has been drawn under the construction loan, respectively.  </I></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2><I>(f)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> On December
&nbsp;1, 2000, the Trust refinanced the debt on this property. The old loan was paid in full and a new note was issued for $77,750 bearing interest at a fixed rate of
7.41% and maturing December&nbsp;11, 2010. The Trust incurred a loss on early extinguishment of the old debt in 2000 of $375.  </I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>81</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_fy1260_1_82"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Certain mortgage loan agreements contain a prepayment penalty provision for the early extinguishment of the debt. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Total
interest costs capitalized for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999 was $1,905 and $290, respectively. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
fair value of mortgage notes payable at December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999 is estimated to be approximately $714,084 and $621,393, respectively, based on interest rates for comparable loans. </FONT></P>

above debt matures as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5. Related Party Transactions:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Trust engages the Macerich Management Company (the "Management Company"), an affiliate of the Company, to manage the operations of the Trust. The Management
Company provides property management, leasing, corporate, redevelopment and acquisitions services to the properties of the Trust. In consideration of these services, the Management Company receives
monthly management fees ranging from 1.0% to 4.0% of the gross monthly rental revenue of the properties managed. During the year ended 2000 and the period ended 1999, the Trust incurred management
fees of $4,584 and $2,253, respectively, to the Management Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>A
mortgage note collateralized by the office component of Redmond Town Center is held by one of the Company's joint venture partners. In connection with this note, interest expense was $4,953 and
$2,192 during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2000 and the period ended 1999, respectively. Additionally, $386 and $248 of interest costs were capitalized during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2000 and the period ended 1999, respectively, in relation to this note. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>82</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>7. Redeemable Preferred Stock:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On October&nbsp;6, 1999, the Trust issued 125 shares of Series&nbsp;A Redeemable Preferred Shares of Beneficial Interest ("Preferred Stock") for proceeds
totaling $500 in a private placement. On October&nbsp;26, 1999, the Trust issued 254 and 246 shares of Preferred Stock to the Corp and Ontario Teachers', respectively. The Preferred Stock can be
redeemed by the Trust at any time with 15&nbsp;days notice for $4,000 per share plus accumulated and unpaid dividends and the applicable redemption premium. The Preferred Stock will pay a semiannual
dividend equal to $300 per share. The Preferred Stock has limited voting rights. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>8. Commitments:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Trust has certain properties subject to non-cancelable operating ground leases. The leases expire at various times through 2069, subject in some
cases to options to extend the terms of the lease. Ground rent expense, net of amounts capitalized, was $634 and $905 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2000 and the period ended 1999,
respectively. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>83</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ga1260_1_85"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Independent Auditors' Report  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Partners SDG Macerich Properties, L.P.: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
have audited the accompanying balance sheets of SDG Macerich Properties, L.P. as of December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999, and the related statements of operations, cash flows, and partners' equity for
each of the years in the three year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2000. In connection with our audits of the financial statements, we have also audited the related financial statement schedule
(Schedule&nbsp;III). These financial statements and the financial statement schedule are the responsibility of the Partnership's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these
financial statements and the financial statement schedule based on our audits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
conducted our audits in accordance with auditing standards generally accepted in the United States of America. Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable
assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial
statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe
that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of SDG Macerich Properties, L.P. as of December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999,
and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the years in the three year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2000, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the
United States of America. Also, in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule (Schedule&nbsp;III), when considered in relation to the basic financial statements taken as a whole, presents
fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>As
discussed in Note&nbsp;2(a) to the financial statements, the Partnership changed its method of accounting for overage rent in 2000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Indianapolis,
Indiana<BR>
February&nbsp;9, 2001 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_gg1260_1_90"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>(1) General  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(a) Partnership Organization<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>On December&nbsp;29, 1997, affiliates of Simon Property Group,&nbsp;Inc. (Simon) and The Macerich Company (Macerich) formed a limited partnership to acquire and operate a
portfolio of 12 regional shopping centers. SDG Macerich Properties, L.P. (the Partnership) acquired the properties on February&nbsp;27, 1998, and the accompanying financial statements include the
results of operations of the properties since the date of acquisition. As a result, the statement of operations presented for 1998 only represents ten months of activity. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(b) Properties<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Affiliates of Simon and Macerich each manage six of the shopping centers. The shopping centers and their locations are as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(2) Summary of Significant Accounting Policies  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(a) Revenues<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All leases are classified as operating leases, and minimum rents are recognized monthly on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Most
retail tenants are also required to pay overage rents based on sales over a stated base amount during the lease year, generally ending on January&nbsp;31. Overage rents are recognized as
revenues based on reported and estimated sales for each tenant through December&nbsp;31. Differences between estimated and actual amounts are recognized in the subsequent year. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>During
January&nbsp;2000, the Emerging Issues Task Force addressed certain revenue recognition policies which required overage rent to be recognized as revenue only when each tenant's sales exceeded
its
threshold. The Partnership previously recognized overage rent before the threshold was met based on tenant sales over a prorated base sales amount. The Partnership changed its accounting effective
January&nbsp;1, 2000 and recorded a loss for the cumulative effect of the change of $1,053. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant
recoveries for real estate taxes and common area maintenance are adjusted annually based on the actual expenses, and the related revenues are recognized in the year in which the expenses are
incurred. Charges for other operating expenses are billed monthly with periodic adjustments based on the estimated utility usage and/or a current price index, and the related revenues are recognized
as the amounts are billed and as adjustments become determinable. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>91</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=93,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=811477,FOLIO='91',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]GG1260A.;24',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:12' -->
<A NAME="page_gg1260_1_92"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(b) Cash Equivalents<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>All highly liquid debt instruments purchased with a maturity of three months or less are considered to be cash equivalents. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(c) Properties<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Properties are recorded at cost and are depreciated using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Buildings and improvements</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>39 years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Equipment and furnishings</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>5-7 years</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Tenant improvements</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>Initial term of related lease</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=3><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>Improvements and replacements are capitalized when they extend the useful life, increase capacity, or improve the efficiency of the asset. All repairs and maintenance items are
expensed as incurred. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Partnership assesses whether there has been an impairment in the value of a property by considering factors such as expected future operating income, trends and prospects, as well as the effects
of demand, competition and other economic factors. Such factors include the tenants' ability to perform their duties and pay rent under the terms of the leases. The Partnership would recognize an
impairment loss if the estimated future income stream of a property is not sufficient to recover its investment. Such a loss would be the difference between the carrying value and the fair value of a
property. Management believes no impairment in its net property carrying values have occurred. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(d) Financing Costs<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Financing costs of $2,866 related to the proceeds of mortgage notes obtained April&nbsp;12, 2000 are being amortized to interest expense over the remaining life of the notes.
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(e) Use of Estimates<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates and
assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual
results could differ from those estimates. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>(f) Income Taxes<BR>  </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>As a partnership, the allocated share of income or loss for the year is includable in the income tax returns of the partners; accordingly, income taxes are not reflected in the
accompanying financial statements. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>92</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=94,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=931351,FOLIO='92',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA0.01WLA1260]GG1260A.;24',USER='DMALONE',CD='29-MAR-2001;12:12' -->
<A NAME="page_gg1260_1_93"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(3) Mortgage Notes Payable and Fair Value of Financial Instruments  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In connection with the acquisition of the properties in 1998, the Partnership assumed $485,000 of mortgage notes secured by the properties. The notes consist of
$300,000 of debt that is due in May&nbsp;2006
and requires monthly interest payments at a fixed weighted average rate of 7.41% and $185,000 of debt that is due in May&nbsp;2003 and requires monthly interest payments at a variable weighted
average rate (based on LIBOR) of 7.21% at December&nbsp;31, 2000 (6.96% at December&nbsp;31, 1999). The variable rate debt is covered by an interest cap agreement that effectively prevents the
variable rate from exceeding 11.53%. In March&nbsp;2000, the Partnership made a principal payment of $500 on the variable rate debt in order to obtain $138,500 of additional mortgage financing. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
fair value assigned to the $300,000 fixed-rate debt at the acquisition date based on an estimated market interest rate of 6.23% was $322,711, and the resultant debt premium is being
amortized to interest expense over the remaining term of the debt using a level yield method. At December&nbsp;31, 2000 and 1999, the unamortized balance of the debt premium was $16,114 and $18,565,
respectively. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>On
April&nbsp;12, 2000, the Partnership obtained $138,500 of additional mortgage financing which is also secured by the properties. The notes consist of $57,100 of debt that requires monthly
interest payments at a fixed weighted average rate of 8.13% and $81,400 of debt that requires monthly interest payments at a variable weighted average rate (based on LIBOR) of 7.08% at
December&nbsp;31, 2000. All of the notes mature on May&nbsp;15, 2006. The variable rate debt is covered by an interest cap agreement that effectively prevents the variable rate from exceeding
11.83%. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
fair value of the fixed-rate debt of $357,100 at December&nbsp;31, 2000 and $300,000 at December&nbsp;31, 1999, based on an interest rate of 6.94% and 8.34%, respectively, is
estimated to be $368,892 and $288,261, respectively. The carrying value of the variable-rate debt of $265,900 and the Partnership's other financial instruments are estimated to approximate
their fair values. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>SFAS&nbsp;133
will be effective for the Partnership beginning January&nbsp;1, 2001 and may not be applied retroactively. The fair value of the interest rate cap agreements is to be reflected in
the balance sheet as derivative financial instruments, and changes in the fair values are to be recognized currently in earnings or other comprehensive earnings. The impact of this change of
accounting is not significant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Interest
costs of $195 were capitalized in 2000 as a component of the cost of major development projects. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>93</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_gg1260_1_94"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(4) Management Services  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Management fees incurred in 2000, 1999 and 1998 totaled $1,900, $1,960 and $1,592, respectively, for the Simon-managed properties and $1,862, $1,803 and $1,470,
respectively, for the Macerich-managed properties, both based on a fee of 4% of gross receipts, as defined. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(5) Contingent Liability  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Partnership currently is not involved with any litigation other than routine and administrative proceedings arising in the ordinary course of business. On
the basis of consultation with counsel, management believes that these items will not have a material adverse impact on the Partnership's financial statements taken as a whole. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>94</FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.1-7
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>a2042811zex-10_17.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.1.7
<TEXT>

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE> Prepared by MERRILL CORPORATION www.edgaradvantage.com
</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#01WLA1260_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lg1261_exhibit_10.1.7"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lg1261_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.1.7    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lg1261_eighth_amendment_to_the_amende__eig04162"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lg1261_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EIGHTH AMENDMENT TO THE<BR>  AMENDED AND RESTATED<BR>  LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT OF<BR>  THE MACERICH PARTNERSHIP, L.P    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS EIGHTH AMENDMENT (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Amendment</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") TO THE AMENDED AND RESTATED LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT DATED AS OF
MARCH 16, 1994, AMENDED AS OF AUGUST 14, 1995, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF JUNE 27, 1997, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF NOVEMBER 16, 1997, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF FEBRUARY 25, 1998, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF FEBRUARY 26,
1998, FURTHER AMENDED AS OF JUNE 17, 1998, AND FURTHER AMENDED AS OF DECEMBER 23, 1998 (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Agreement</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") OF THE MACERICH PARTNERSHIP, L.P. (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Partnership</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") is made and entered into effective as of November&nbsp;9, 2000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the General Partner on behalf of the Partnership and on its own behalf is contemplating a repurchase of shares of the Common
Stock of the General Partner which would enable and be funded by a simultaneous redemption of a number of Common Units held by the General Partner at the price paid for the repurchased shares in the
manner described below; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the General Partner and Partnership will effect such repurchase and redemption if they determine such transactions to be in
the best interest of the Partnership, the Partners and the stockholders of the General Partner, as applicable; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, it is proposed that the Agreement be amended in accordance with the provisions thereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, pursuant to the authority granted to the General Partner under the Agreement, in its capacity as General Partner and as
a holder of a 1% Percentage Interest as General Partner and a 79% Percentage Interest as a Limited Partner in the Partnership, the Agreement is hereby amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendment to Article&nbsp;IX:</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The caption of Article&nbsp;IX is changed
to "Redemptions"; and a new section&nbsp;9.2 is added to the Agreement immediately following </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;9.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> thereof as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;Redemption on Share Repurchase.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, the General
Partner is hereby authorized to cause the Partnership to redeem for cash Common Units from the General Partner, in connection and simultaneous with any repurchase by the General Partner of Shares, at
the price paid for the repurchased Shares. The number of such Common Units will equal the number of repurchased Shares divided by the Conversion Factor and the aggregate redemption price of the Common
Units will be in an amount necessary to provide the General Partner with an amount in cash equal to the aggregate price paid by the General Partner to repurchase the Shares. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Conforming Clarifications to Sections 6.2.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;8.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is amended to add to the beginning thereof the phrase "Except in the case of a redemption
authorized pursuant to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;9.2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>," and decapitalizing the word "The" which follows; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;6.2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> is amended by deletion of the "and" after clause&nbsp;(i) thereof, adding "; and" after
clause&nbsp;(j) thereof, and adding a new clause&nbsp;(k) as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)&nbsp;To
take other action not inconsistent with applicable law expressly contemplated by other provisions of this Agreement." </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Defined Terms and Recitals.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;As used in this Amendment, capitalized terms
used and defined in this Amendment shall have the meaning assigned to them in this Amendment, and capitalized terms </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="2",CHK=275542,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LG1261A.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
used in this Amendment but not defined herein, shall have the meaning assigned to them in the Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Ratification and Confirmation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Except to the extent specifically amended by
this Amendment, the terms and provisions of the Agreement, as previously amended, are hereby ratified and confirmed. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notice.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The General Partner shall give notice of this Amendment to the
Partners as required by Section&nbsp;12.1(b) of the Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the undersigned has executed this Amendment effective as of the date first above mentioned in its capacity as
General Partner and as the holder of a 1% Percentage Interest as General Partner and a 79% Percentage Interest as a Limited Partner. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>among </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE MACERICH PARTNERSHIP, L.P.,<BR>

<TD WIDTH="16%"><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;3.5.</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="16%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%"><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;3.8.</FONT></TD>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1261_second_amended_and_rest__kg102302"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1261_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED<BR>  CREDIT AND GUARANTY AGREEMENT    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED CREDIT AND GUARANTY AGREEMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, dated as of March&nbsp;22, 2001 (as amended from
time to time, this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Agreement"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), by and among </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE MACERICH PARTNERSHIP, L.P.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, a Delaware limited
partnership (the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Borrower"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE ENTITIES FROM TIME TO TIME PARTIES HERETO AS GUARANTORS, THE MACERICH
COMPANY</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, a Maryland corporation (the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"REIT"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE BANKS AND OTHER FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS THAT EITHER NOW
OR IN THE FUTURE ARE PARTIES HERETO</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (collectively, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Lenders"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and each individually, a </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"Lender"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), and </FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WELLS FARGO BANK, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (including in its capacity as an issuer of Letters
of Credit, the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Agent Bank"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), as agent and representative for the Lenders (the Agent Bank in such capacity or any successor in such capacity is referred
to herein as the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Agent"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). The Lenders (including the Agent Bank) and the Agent are collectively referred to herein as the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"Lender Parties"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and each
individually as a </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Lender Party."</I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1261_r_e_c_i_t_a_l_s"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1261_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>R E C I T A L S    <BR>  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Borrower, the Guarantors, the REIT, the Agent and the Agent Bank have entered into a First Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement dated as of
June&nbsp;25, 1998, as amended (the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>"Existing Credit Agreement"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;&nbsp;As
of the Closing Date, (I)&nbsp;the Existing Credit Agreement is being amended and restated as set forth herein and (II)&nbsp;all outstanding Advances (the </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>"Existing Advances"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) under the Existing Credit
Agreement will be considered "Advances" under this Agreement, all of which transactions will occur
contemporaneously. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1261_article_1."> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1261_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 1.    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1261_definitions_and_related_matters"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1261_4"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>DEFINITIONS AND RELATED MATTERS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The following terms with initial capital letters have
the following meanings: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Acquisition</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any direct or indirect purchase or acquisition (including pursuant to any merger with any Person other than a
Consolidated Entity prior to such merger) of any Capital Stock of any Person, or all or any substantial part of the business or assets of any Person, or the purchase or acquisition of any Real
Property of any other Person, in each case, either in one transaction or a series of transactions. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Acquisition Advances</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;4.3.1.3. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Acquisition Agreement</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;4.3.1.6. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Advance</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;2.1.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Affiliate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Person, any other Person that, directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries,
controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, such first Person. Unless otherwise indicated, "Affiliate" refers to an Affiliate of any Borrower Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
in no event shall any Lender Party or any Affiliate of any Lender Party be deemed to be an Affiliate of the Borrower. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Agent</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Preamble. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Agent Bank</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Preamble. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Agent's Account</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the account identified on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> as the Agent's
Account or such account as the Agent may hereafter designate by notice to the Borrower and each Lender. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Agent's Office</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the office of the Agent identified as such on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1.B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, or such other office as the Agent may hereafter designate by notice to
the Borrower and each Lender. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=6,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=791559,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KG1261A.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kg1261_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Agreement</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Preamble and includes all Schedules and Exhibits. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Applicable Law</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all applicable provisions of all (i)&nbsp;constitutions, treaties, statutes, laws, rules, regulations and
ordinances of any Governmental Authority, (ii)&nbsp;Governmental Approvals and (iii)&nbsp;orders, decisions, judgments, awards and decrees of any Governmental Authority. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Applicable Lending Office</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Lender, (i)&nbsp;in the case of any payment with respect to Fixed Rate
Advances, the Lender's LIBO Lending Office, and (ii)&nbsp;in the case of any payment with respect to Base Rate Advances or any other payment under the Loan Documents, the Lender's Domestic Lending
Office. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Applicable LIBO Margin</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, in respect of Fixed Rate Advances at any date, (i)&nbsp;1.350% per annum if the ratio of Total
Liabilities to Gross Asset Value (expressed as a percentage) as of the last day of the Fiscal Quarter most recently ended is less than 50.0%, (ii)&nbsp;1.500% per annum if the ratio of Total
Liabilities to Gross Asset Value (expressed as a percentage) as of the last day of the Fiscal Quarter most recently ended is greater than or equal to 50.0% but less than 55.0%, (iii)&nbsp;1.650% per
annum if the ratio of the Total Liabilities to Gross Asset Value (expressed as a percentage) as of the last day of the Fiscal Quarter most recently ended is greater than or equal to 55.0% but less
than 60.0%, or (iv)&nbsp;1.800% per annum if none of clause&nbsp;(i), (ii)&nbsp;or (iii)&nbsp;applies (including if the Pricing Certificate showing that any of clause&nbsp;(i),
(ii)&nbsp;or (iii), as the case may be, is satisfied is not delivered when required hereby), </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> in the case of any of clause&nbsp;(i),
(ii)&nbsp;or (iii), at least four Business Days shall have expired from the day on which the Borrower shall have delivered a Pricing Certificate showing that any of clause&nbsp;(i), (ii)&nbsp;or
(iii)&nbsp;is satisfied and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, further</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that any change in the Applicable LIBO Margin resulting from the change in the ratio of Total
Liabilities to Gross Asset Value shall not take effect until the fifth Business Day after the Pricing Certificate with respect to a Fiscal Quarter is (or is required to be) delivered. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Applicable LIBO Rate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, in respect of Fixed Rate Advances, the rate of interest, rounded upward (if necessary) to the nearest
whole multiple of .01%, equal to the sum of (x)&nbsp;the Applicable LIBO Margin, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (y)&nbsp;the LIBO Rate, which LIBO Rate is divided by 1.00
minus the Reserve Percentage, which may be expressed as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="76%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="32%"><FONT SIZE=2>Applicable LIBO Rate</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>=</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%"><FONT SIZE=2>Applicable LIBO Margin +</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%"><FONT SIZE=2>LIBO&nbsp;Rate&nbsp;/&nbsp;(1&nbsp;-&nbsp;Reserve&nbsp;Percentage)</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Assigned Commitments</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Recitals. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Assignment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" and "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Assignment and Acceptance</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" are defined in Section&nbsp;10.5.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Bankruptcy Code</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Title 11 of the United States Code (11 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;101 </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>et
seq.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Bankruptcy Remote Entity</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a Consolidated Entity (i)&nbsp;one hundred percent of the Capital Stock of which is owned, directly
or indirectly, by the Borrower or the REIT and (ii)&nbsp;which is a so-called "bankruptcy remote special purpose vehicle" or "bankruptcy remote SPV" that meets, or at the time such
Consolidated Entity first added the applicable provisions to its organizational documents met, the published criteria in effect from time to time of S&amp;P, Moody's, Duff&nbsp;&amp; Phelps Credit Rating
Co. or Fitch Investors Service&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Base Rate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a fluctuating interest rate per annum as shall be in effect from time to time, which rate per annum shall at all
times be equal to the higher of: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
then effective Prime Rate; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
then effective Federal Funds Rate </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;0.50%. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=7,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=682298,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KG1261A.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kg1261_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Each
change in the interest rate on Advances based on a change in the Base Rate shall be effective as of the effective date of such change in the Base Rate. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Base Rate Advance</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Advance that constitutes or, when made, will constitute, part of the Base Rate Portion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Base Rate Portion</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, the portion or portions of the unpaid principal balance of all Advances bearing interest at a
rate determined by reference to the Base Rate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Board of Directors</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Board of Directors, as constituted from time to time, of the REIT (in the case of actions to be taken by
the REIT, the Borrower or any other Borrower Party or Consolidated Entity of which the REIT is the general partner or manager) or of any other Borrower Party or Consolidated Entity (as in the case of
actions to be taken by such Borrower Party or Consolidated Entity or by any other Borrower Party or Consolidated Entity of which such Borrower Party or Consolidated Entity is the general partner or
manager). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Borrower</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Preamble and includes its successors and permitted assigns. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Borrower Account</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the account of the Borrower identified as such on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;10.4.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, or such other account as the Borrower may hereafter designate by
notice to the Agent (including in connection with a Credit Sweep
Program), </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that if such account is maintained with any Person other than the Agent Bank, such designation shall not be effective unless and
until a Funds Transfer Agreement and all documents contemplated thereby are executed and delivered by the Borrower to the Agent Bank. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Borrower Party</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Borrower, any Guarantor or the REIT. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, recourse to the REIT
for payment and performance of the Obligations is limited as set forth in Section&nbsp;10.12. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Borrowing</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a contemporaneous borrowing of Advances or the issuance of a Letter of Credit, as applicable. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Bullet Payment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any payment of the entire unpaid balance of any Debt at its final maturity other than the final payment with
respect to a loan that is fully amortized over its term. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Business Day</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a day of the week (but not a Saturday, Sunday or holiday) on which the offices of banks located in San Francisco
and Los Angeles, California are open to the public for carrying on substantially all of such banks' business functions, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that with respect to
any Fixed Rate Advance, "Business Day" shall further mean any day on which commercial banks are open for dealings in Dollar deposits in the London interbank market. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Capital Stock</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Person, all (i)&nbsp;shares, interests, participations or other equivalents (howsoever
designated) of capital stock or partnership or other equity interests of such Person and (ii)&nbsp;rights (other than debt securities convertible into capital stock or other equity interests),
warrants or options to acquire any such capital stock or partnership or other equity interests of such Person. The term "Capital Stock" includes the Partnership Units of the Borrower. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Capitalized Leases</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all leases of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities of real or personal property that are required to be
capitalized on the consolidated balance sheets of such Persons. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Capitalized Loan Fees</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to the REIT, any Consolidated Entity or any Unconsolidated Joint Venture, and with respect
to any period, any upfront, closing or similar fees paid by such Person in connection with the incurrence or refinancing of Debt during such period that are capitalized on the balance sheet of such
Person. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Closing Date</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the earliest date upon which all of the conditions to the effectiveness of this Agreement set forth in
Section&nbsp;4.1. are satisfied. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=8,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=405684,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KG1261A.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kg1261_1_4"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Code</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Collateral</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;3.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Commencement of Construction</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" with respect to a Real Property, means the commencement of material on-site work (including
grading) or the commencement of a work of improvement of such Real Property. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Commitment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to each Lender, the amount set forth for such Lender as its "Commitment" on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1.A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, as reduced or terminated from
time to time pursuant to the terms hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Commitment Usage</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, (i)&nbsp;with respect to any Lender, the sum of (A)&nbsp;the aggregate unpaid principal
amount of all Advances made by such Lender, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (B)&nbsp;the Lender's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of all Letter of
Credit Liability, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (C)&nbsp;the Lender's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of the Interest Reserve or
(ii)&nbsp;with respect to all Lenders, the sum of (A)&nbsp;the aggregate unpaid principal amount of all Advances made by all Lenders, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
(B)&nbsp;all Letter of Credit Liability, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (C)&nbsp;the Interest Reserve, in each case, giving effect to the Borrowings then requested. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Compliance Certificate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a certificate of the chief financial officer and the secretary of each Borrower Party, substantially in
the form of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;C-4</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Consolidated Entities</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, collectively, (i)&nbsp;the Borrower, (ii)&nbsp;any other Person the accounts of which are
consolidated with those of the REIT in the consolidated financial statements of the REIT in accordance with GAAP, and (iii)&nbsp;except for purposes of Sections 7.1.2. and 7.3., all Unconsolidated
Joint Ventures of which any Consolidated Entity is a general partner or of which any Consolidated Entity owns more than 50% of the Capital Stock. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Construction-in-Process</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Retail Property Under Construction, the aggregate amount
of expenditures classified as "construction-in-process" on the REIT's balance sheet with respect thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Contingent Obligation</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, as to any Person, any obligation, direct or indirect, contingent or otherwise, of such Person
(i)&nbsp;with respect to any Debt or other obligation of another Person, including any direct or indirect guarantee of such Debt (other than any endorsement for collection in the ordinary course of
business) or any other direct or indirect obligation, by agreement or otherwise, to purchase or repurchase any such Debt or obligation or any security therefor, or to provide funds for the payment or
discharge of any such Debt or obligation (whether in the form of loans, advances, stock purchases, capital contributions or otherwise), (ii)&nbsp;to provide funds to maintain the financial condition
of the other Person, or (iii)&nbsp;otherwise to assure or hold harmless the holders of Debt or other obligation of another Person against loss in respect thereof. The amount of any Contingent
Obligation shall be an
amount equal to the amount of the Debt or obligation guaranteed or otherwise supported thereby. Notwithstanding the foregoing, "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Contingent Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"
shall not include (w)&nbsp;any obligation of the Borrower or any of the Consolidated Entities under any contract for the acquisition of Real Property entered into in the ordinary course to pay the
purchase price of such Real Property prior to the transfer of title to such Real Property, (x)&nbsp;any unliquidated contingent liabilities under environmental indemnities given by the Borrower or
any of the Consolidated Entities, (y)&nbsp;any unliquidated contingent liabilities under recourse exceptions to any Non-Recourse Debt to the extent that such exceptions relate to:
(1)&nbsp;misapplication or misappropriation of insurance or condemnation proceeds, security deposits or rents; (2)&nbsp;fraud; (3)&nbsp;waste; (4)&nbsp;violations of transfer provisions; or
(5)&nbsp;gross negligence or willful misconduct which results in the loss of property or (z)&nbsp;any amount representing the excess of the obligations of an Unconsolidated Joint Venture over the
Borrower's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of such obligations. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_kg1261_1_5"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Contractual Obligation</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, as applied to any Person, any provision of any security issued by that Person or of any agreement or
other instrument to which that Person is a party or by which it or any of the properties owned by it is bound or otherwise subject. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Control</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power, whether or not exercised, to direct or cause the direction of the
management or policies of a Person, whether through the ownership of Capital Stock, by contract or otherwise, and the terms "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>controlled</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" and
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>common control</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" have correlative meanings. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Controlled Consolidated Entity</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Consolidated Entity, except an Unconsolidated Joint Venture that is not controlled by the
REIT or the Borrower, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that any Unconsolidated Joint Venture the general partners of which include both a Consolidated Entity (or a Person
controlled by a Consolidated Entity) and a Person (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Third Person</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") other than a Consolidated Entity (or an Affiliate of a Consolidated Entity) shall
not be a Controlled Consolidated Entity as to any transaction or matter that such Third Person has the power, under Applicable Law, to engage in or undertake on behalf of the Unconsolidated Joint
Venture without the consent of the Consolidated Entity that is also a general partner (whether or not such consent would be required under the partnership agreement or any other Contractual Obligation
of the Third Person or the Unconsolidated Joint Venture). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Controlled Group</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all domestic and foreign members of a controlled group of corporations under Section&nbsp;1563(a) of the
Code (determined without regard to Section&nbsp;1563(b)(2)(C) of the Code) and all trades or businesses (irrespective of whether incorporated) that are under common control with the REIT. With
regard to all Plans and Multiemployer Plans, "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Controlled Group</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" includes all ERISA Affiliates. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Credit Sweep Program</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;2.1.3.3. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Cut-off Date</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;4.3.2.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Debt</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Person, the aggregate amount of, without duplication: (i)&nbsp;all obligations for borrowed money
including, in the case of the REIT, the Permitted Subordinated Debentures; (ii)&nbsp;all obligations evidenced by bonds, debentures, notes or other similar instruments; (iii)&nbsp;all obligations
to pay the deferred purchase price of property or services (excluding current trade accounts payable arising in the ordinary course of business not overdue by more than 60&nbsp;days);
(iv)&nbsp;all Capitalized Leases; (v)&nbsp;all obligations or liabilities of others secured by a Lien on any asset owned by such Person or Persons whether or not such obligation or liability is
assumed; (vi)&nbsp;all obligations of such Person or Persons, contingent or otherwise, in respect of any letters of credit or bankers' acceptances; (vii)&nbsp;the maximum fixed redemption or
repurchase price of Disqualified Capital Stock of such Person at the date of determination, (viii)&nbsp;all Contingent Obligations and (ix)&nbsp;the Interest Reserve, which shall be considered
Unsecured Debt for purposes of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Default</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any condition or event that, with the giving of notice or lapse of time or both, would, unless cured or waived, become
an Event of Default. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Defaulting Lender</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;9.10.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Defined Benefit Plan</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any pension plan subject to Title IV of ERISA including a Multiemployer Plan and any money purchase
pension plan subject to the funding requirements of Section&nbsp;412 of the Code. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Depreciation and Amortization Expense</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means (without duplication), for any period, the sum for such period of (i)&nbsp;total
depreciation and amortization expense, whether paid or accrued, of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (ii)&nbsp;the REIT's and any
Consolidated Entity's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of depreciation and amortization expenses of Unconsolidated Joint Ventures. For purposes of this definition, the
REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of depreciation and amortization expense of any Unconsolidated Joint Venture shall be deemed equal to the product of
(i)&nbsp;the depreciation and amortization expense of </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
