<A NAME="page_kg1261_1_6"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
such Unconsolidated Joint Venture, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (ii)&nbsp;the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock of such Person held by the REIT or
any Consolidated Entity, expressed as a decimal. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Disqualified Capital Stock</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of any Person means any Capital Stock of such Person (other than preferred stock of the REIT issued and
outstanding on the Closing Date) that by its terms (or by the terms of any security into which it is convertible or for which it is exchangeable), or otherwise (including upon the occurrence of any
event), is required to be redeemed or is redeemable for cash at the option of the holder thereof, in whole or in part (including by operation of a sinking fund), or is exchangeable for Debt (other
than at the option of such Person), in whole or in part, at any time prior to the 91st day after the Maturity Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Dollars</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>"$</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means lawful money of the United States of America. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Domestic Lending Office</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the office, branch or Affiliate of the Lender identified on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> designated as its Domestic Lending Office or such
other office, branch or Affiliate as such Lender may hereafter designate as its
Domestic Lending Office for one or more types of Advances by notice to the Borrower and the Agent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>EBITDA</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any period, (i)&nbsp;Net Income, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (without duplication)
(A)&nbsp;Interest Expense, (B)&nbsp;Tax Expense, and (C)&nbsp;Depreciation and Amortization Expense, in each case for such period. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Effective Rate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;2.4.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Eligible Assignee</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;10.5.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Environmental Damages</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all claims, judgments, damages, losses, penalties, liabilities (including strict liability), costs and
expenses, including costs of investigation, remediation, defense, settlement and attorneys' fees and consultants' fees, that are incurred at any time as a result of the existence of Hazardous
Materials upon, about or beneath any Real Property or migrating or threatening to migrate to or from any Real Property, or arising in any manner whatsoever out of any violation of Environmental
Requirements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Environmental Lien</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a Lien in favor of any Governmental Authority for Environmental Damages. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Environmental Requirements</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all Applicable Laws relating to Hazardous Materials or the protection of human health or the
environment, including all requirements pertaining to reporting, permitting, investigation and remediation of releases or threatened releases of Hazardous Materials into the environment, or relating
to the manufacture, processing, distribution, use, treatment, storage, disposal, transport or handling of Hazardous Materials. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>ERISA</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>ERISA Affiliate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Person that is or was a member of the controlled group of corporations or trades or businesses (as defined
in Subsection (b), (c), (m)&nbsp;or (o)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;414 of the Code) of which any Borrower Party is or was a member at any time within the last six years. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>fair salable value</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;3.9. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>fair valuation</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;3.9. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Federal Funds Rate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any day, the rate per annum (rounded upwards, if necessary, to the nearest 1/100th of 1%) equal to the
weighted average of the rates on overnight Federal funds transactions with members of the Federal Reserve System arranged by Federal funds brokers on such day, as published for such day (or, if such
day is not a Business Day, for the next preceding Business Day) by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York on the Business Day next succeeding such day, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that if such rate is not so published for
any day that is a Business Day, the Federal Funds Rate for such day shall be the average rate charged
to the Agent Bank on such day on such transactions as determined by the Agent Bank. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Federal Reserve Board</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, or any successor thereto. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fee Letter</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means that certain letter dated February&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2001 between the Borrower and the Agent, as amended from time
to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fees</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, collectively, the fees described or referenced in the Fee Letter and in Section&nbsp;2.6. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fiscal Year</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the fiscal year of the REIT, which shall be the 12-month period ending on December&nbsp;31 in each
year or such other period as the REIT may designate and the Agent may approve in writing. "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Fiscal Quarter</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" or "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>fiscal
quarter</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any three-month period ending on March&nbsp;31, June&nbsp;30 or September&nbsp;30 of any Fiscal Year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Charges</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any period, the sum of the amounts for such period of (i)&nbsp;scheduled payments of principal of Debt of
the REIT and the Consolidated Entities (other than any Bullet Payment), (ii)&nbsp;the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of scheduled payments of principal of Debt
of Unconsolidated Joint Ventures (other than any Bullet Payment) that does not otherwise constitute Debt of and is not otherwise recourse to the REIT and the Consolidated Entities or their assets,
(iii)&nbsp;Interest Expense, (iv)&nbsp;payments of dividends in respect of Disqualified Capital Stock and (v)&nbsp;an amount equal to $0.05 per quarter, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied
by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Gross Leasable Area of all Real Properties wholly-owned by the Consolidated Entities and the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of the Gross
Leasable Area of all the Real Properties owned by the
Unconsolidated Joint Ventures and the Gross Leasable Area of all the Real Properties partially-owned by the Consolidated Entities, in each case, at the end of such period </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>minus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (vi)&nbsp;to the extent
otherwise included in Interest Expense, dividends and other distributions paid during such period by the Borrower or the
REIT with respect to preferred stock. For purposes of clauses (ii)&nbsp;and (v), the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of payments by or square footage of any
Unconsolidated Joint Venture shall be deemed equal to the product of (a)&nbsp;the payments made by or square footage of such Unconsolidated Joint Venture, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied
by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (b)&nbsp;the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock of such Person held by the REIT or any Consolidated Entity, expressed as a decimal. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, the ratio of (i)&nbsp;EBITDA for the fiscal quarter then most recently ended, to
(ii)&nbsp;Fixed Charges for such period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Applicable LIBO Rate as accepted by the Borrower as an Effective Rate for a particular Fixed Rate Period and
Fixed Rate Portion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate Advance</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Advance that constitutes or, when made, will constitute, the Fixed Rate Portion of any Advance. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate Commencement Date</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;2.4.2.4. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ki1261_1_8"> </A>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate Notice</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Fixed Rate Advance, a written notice, substantially in the form of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;B-3</I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2>, which confirms the Fixed Rate for a particular Fixed Rate Period and the Fixed Rate Portion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate Period</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the period or periods of any Fixed Rate Advance, (a)&nbsp;one, two, three or six months; or (b)&nbsp;any
other period of at least one month that ends at the Maturity Date, which periods are selected by the Borrower pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.4.2. and may be confirmed in a Fixed Rate Notice; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that
no Fixed Rate Period shall extend beyond the Maturity Date. Notwithstanding the foregoing: (a)&nbsp;if a Fixed Rate Advance is
continued, the Fixed Rate Period applicable to the continued or converted Advance shall commence on the day on which the Fixed Rate Period applicable to such Fixed Rate Advance ends; and
(b)&nbsp;any Fixed Rate Period applicable to a Fixed Rate Advance (1)&nbsp;that would otherwise end on a day that is not a Business Day shall be extended to the next succeeding Business Day,
unless such succeeding Business Day falls in another calendar month, in which case such Fixed Rate Period shall end on the next preceding Business Day or (2)&nbsp;that begins on the last Business
Day of a calendar month (or on a day for which there is no numerically corresponding day in the calendar month at the end of such Fixed Rate Period) shall end on the last Business Day of the calendar
month at the end of such Fixed Rate Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate Portion</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the portion or portions of the unpaid principal balance of all Advances that the Borrower selects to have
subject to a Fixed Rate. The Fixed Rate Portion shall comply with Sections 2.4.2.7. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Fixed Rate Price Adjustment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;2.13. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Floating Rate Debt</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;7.3.6. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Funding Date</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any date on which an Advance is (or is requested to be) made or a Letter of Credit is (or is requested to be)
issued. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Funds From Operations</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" or "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>FFO</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any period, the "Funds From Operations"
calculated for such period in accordance with NAREIT Guidelines, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that, notwithstanding Section&nbsp;10.8., the components of Funds From
Operations or FFO shall be calculated on the basis of, and in accordance
with, GAAP as it exists on the date of this Agreement, and no effect shall be given to any changes to such accounting principles that may be made from time to time after the Closing Date. It is
understood by the parties that, notwithstanding the internal accounting practices or operations of the Borrower, the defined terms included in this definition shall have the meanings set forth in this
Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Funds Transfer Agreement</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a Funds Transfer Agreement for Disbursement of Loan Proceeds between the Agent Bank and the Borrower,
on the Agent Bank's standard form, executed and delivered after the date of the Existing Credit Agreement as contemplated by the definition of "Borrower Account," as such agreement may be amended from
time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>GAAP</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means generally accepted accounting principles as in effect in the United States of America (as such principles are in effect on
the date hereof), [except for such deviations or adjustments as are necessary in order to eliminate the effect of Staff Accounting Bulletin No.&nbsp;101 issued by the Financial
Accounting Standards Board]. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Governmental Approval</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means an authorization, consent, approval, permit or license issued by, or a registration or filing with, any
Governmental Authority. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Governmental Authority</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any nation and any state or political subdivision thereof and any entity exercising executive,
legislative, judicial, regulatory or administrative functions of or pertaining to government and any tribunal or arbitrator of competent jurisdiction. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=13,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=488650,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KI1261A.;6',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1261_1_9"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Gross Asset Value</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, the sum of (without duplication): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;for
Retail Properties that are Wholly-Owned the sum of, for each such property, (a)&nbsp;such property's Property NOI for the Measuring Period, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>divided by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (b)&nbsp;(1) 8.25% (expressed as a decimal), in the
case of regional Retail Properties or (2)&nbsp;9.50% (expressed as a decimal) in the
case of Retail Properties that are not regional Retail Properties, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;for
Retail Properties that are not Wholly-Owned, the sum of, for each such property, (a)&nbsp;the Gross Asset Value of each such Retail Property at such time, as
calculated pursuant to the foregoing clause&nbsp;(i), </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (b)&nbsp;a percentage (expressed as a decimal) equal to the percentage of the
total outstanding
Capital Stock held by the Borrower of the Consolidated Entity or Unconsolidated Joint Venture holding title to such Retail Properties, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;all
cash and Permitted Investments (other than, in either case, Restricted Cash) held by the Consolidated Entities at such time, in the case of cash and Permitted
Investments not Wholly-Owned, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> a percentage (expressed as a decimal) equal to the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock held by
the Borrower of the Consolidated Entity holding title to such cash and Permitted Investments, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;for
Mortgage Loans that are Wholly-Owned, the lowest of (A)&nbsp;the book value of each such Mortgage Loan at the time it is initially acquired, (B)&nbsp;the
book value of each such Mortgage Loan at the time Gross Asset Value is being determined, or (C)&nbsp;the excess, if any, of (1)&nbsp;80% of the Gross Asset Value of the Retail Property securing
such Mortgage Loan, determined pursuant to the applicable clause of this definition as if such Retail Property were Wholly-Owned, over (2)&nbsp;the amount of any Debt and other liabilities or
obligations, absolute or contingent, also secured by a Lien on such Retail Property, which Lien is senior to or </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pari passu</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> with the Lien securing such
Mortgage Loan; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)(a)&nbsp;100%
of Construction-in-Process with respect to Retail Properties that are Wholly-Owned and (b)&nbsp;the product of (1)&nbsp;100% of
Construction-in-Process with respect to Retail Properties Under Construction that are not Wholly-Owned </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
(2)&nbsp;a percentage (expressed as a decimal) equal to the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock held by the Borrower of the Consolidated Entity or Unconsolidated Joint Venture holding
title to such Retail Properties Under Construction; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;to
the extent not otherwise included in the foregoing clauses, (a)&nbsp;the book value of tenant receivables, deferred charges and other assets with respect to
Real Properties that are Wholly-Owned and (b)&nbsp;the product of (1)&nbsp;the book value of tenant receivables, deferred charges and other assets with respect to Real Properties that are not
Wholly-Owned </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (2)&nbsp;a percentage (expressed as a decimal) equal to the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock held by the
Borrower of the Consolidated Entity or Unconsolidated Joint Venture holding title to such Retail Property (collectively, "Other GAV Assets"), </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
that the aggregate value of Other GAV Assets shall not exceed five percent (5%) of the aggregate Gross Asset Value of all the assets of the Borrower and the Consolidated Entities as a whole; </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that the determination of Gross Asset Value for any period shall not include any Retail Property (or any Property
NOI relating to any Retail Property) that has been sold or otherwise disposed of at any time prior to or during such period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Gross Leasable Area</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the total leasable square footage of buildings situated on Real Properties, excluding the square footage of
any department stores. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Guarantor</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means (i)&nbsp;any Initial Guarantor and (ii)&nbsp;any other Person who from time to time becomes a Guarantor hereunder
by executing and delivering a Joinder Agreement substantially in the </FONT></P>

intangible assets and (ii)&nbsp;all write-ups (other than write-ups resulting from foreign currency translations and write-ups of assets of a going concern
business made within twelve months after the acquisition of such business) subsequent to December&nbsp;31, 1994, in the book value of any asset owned by the REIT or any Consolidated Entity. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Interest Coverage Ratio</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, the ratio of (i)&nbsp;EBITDA for the fiscal quarter then most recently ended, to
(ii)&nbsp;Interest Expense for such period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Interest Expense</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any period, the sum (without duplication) for such period of (i)&nbsp;total interest expense, whether
paid or accrued, of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities, including Fees payable pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.6., charges in respect of Letters of Credit and the portion of any Capitalized Lease
Obligations allocable to interest expense, including the REIT's share of interest expenses in Unconsolidated Joint Ventures but excluding amortization or write-off of debt discount and
expense (except as provided in clause&nbsp;(ii) below), (ii)&nbsp;amortization of costs related to interest rate protection contracts and rate buydowns (other than the costs associated with the
interest rate buydowns completed in connection with the initial public offering of the REIT), (iii)&nbsp;capitalized interest, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that
capitalized interest may be excluded from this clause&nbsp;(iii) to the extent such interest (A)&nbsp;does not exceed the Interest Reserve designated for such period or (B)&nbsp;is paid or
reserved out of any interest reserve established under a loan facility, (iv)&nbsp;for purposes of determining Interest Expense as used in the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio (both numerator and
denominator) only, amortization of Capitalized Loan Fees, (v)&nbsp;to the extent not included in clauses (i), (ii), (iii)&nbsp;and (iv), the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro
rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of interest expense and other amounts of the type referred to in such clauses of the Unconsolidated Joint Ventures, and (vi)&nbsp;interest incurred on any
liability or obligation that constitutes a Contingent Obligation of the REIT or any Consolidated Entity. For purposes of clause&nbsp;(v), the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro
rata</I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>10</FONT></P>

share of interest expense or other amount of any Unconsolidated Joint Venture shall be deemed equal to the product of (a)&nbsp;the interest expense or other relevant amount of such Unconsolidated

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Interest Reserve</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Fiscal Quarter, the dollar amount designated by the Borrower as "Interest Reserve" for

lesser of (i)&nbsp;the

the date of this Agreement, the Interest Reserve shall be equal to $2,000,000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Investment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Person, (i)&nbsp;any direct or indirect purchase or other acquisition by that Person of
Capital Stock, or any beneficial interest in Capital Stock, of any other Person or all or any substantial part of the business or assets of any other Person, or (ii)&nbsp;any direct or indirect
loan, advance or capital contribution by that Person to any other Person, including all indebtedness and accounts receivable from that other Person that are not current assets or did not arise from
sales to that other Person in the ordinary course of business. The amount of any Investment shall be the original cost of such Investment, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the cost
of all additions thereto, without any adjustments for increases or decreases in value, or write-ups, write-downs or write-offs with respect to such Investment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

arrangement, whether in corporate, partnership or other legal form; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that, as to any such arrangement in corporate form, such corporation shall
not, as to any Person of which such corporation is a Subsidiary, be considered to be a Joint Venture to which such Person is a party. </FONT></P>

"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lender Party</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" includes a holder of a Participation. </FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_ki1261_1_13"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Measuring Period</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the period of four consecutive fiscal quarters ended on the last day of the Fiscal Quarter most recently ended
as to which operating statements with respect to a Real Property have been delivered to the Lenders. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Minority Interests</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all of the Partnership Units of the Borrower held by any Person other than the REIT. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Moody's</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Moody's Investors Service,&nbsp;Inc. or any successor. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Mortgage Loans</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means all loans owned or held by the Borrower secured by mortgages or deeds of trust on Retail Properties. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Multiemployer Plan</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a "multiemployer plan" as defined in Section&nbsp;3(37) and Section&nbsp;4001(a)(3) of ERISA to which
the Borrower or any of its ERISA Affiliates is making or accruing an obligation to make contributions or to which any such Person has made or accrued an obligation to make contributions. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>NAREIT Guidelines</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the guidelines published by the National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts as in effect on the
date of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Net Income</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, for any period, total net income (or loss) of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities for such period taken as a
single accounting period, including the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of the income (or loss) of any Unconsolidated Joint Venture for such period, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that
there shall be excluded therefrom (i)&nbsp;any charges for minority interests in the Borrower held by Persons holding Partnership Units
of the Borrower (other than the REIT), (ii)&nbsp;any income or loss attributable to extraordinary items, (iii)&nbsp;gains and losses from sales of assets (other than undeveloped land that
constitutes a portion of any Retail Property), (iv)&nbsp;except to the extent otherwise included hereunder, the income (or loss) of any Person accrued prior to the date it becomes a Consolidated
Entity or is merged with the REIT or any Consolidated Entity or such Person's assets are acquired by the REIT or any Consolidated Entity, and (v)&nbsp;any impairment loss required to be taken in
such period in accordance with Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;121 (Accounting for the Impairment of Long-Lived Assets and for Long-Lived Assets to be
Disposed of) with respect to any long-lived assets to be disposed
of and whose value is being reported during such period at the lower of its carrying amount or fair value. For purposes of this definition, the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro
rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of income (or loss) of any Unconsolidated Joint Venture shall be deemed equal to the product of (i)&nbsp;the income (or loss) of such Unconsolidated Joint Venture, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied
by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (ii)&nbsp;the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock of such Person held by the REIT or any Consolidated Entity, expressed as
a decimal. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Net Worth</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any date, the consolidated stockholders' equity of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities, excluding any amounts
attributable to Disqualified Capital Stock. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>New Lenders</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Recitals. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Non-Recourse Debt</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Debt that (i)&nbsp;is non-recourse to the Consolidated Entities (other than such
Unconsolidated Joint Venture) and their assets and (ii)&nbsp;does not constitute Debt of the Consolidated Entities (other than such Unconsolidated Joint Venture). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Non-Recourse Secured Debt</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Debt that (i)&nbsp;is non-recourse to the Consolidated Entities (other than
such Unconsolidated Joint Venture) and their assets, (ii)&nbsp;does not constitute Debt of the Consolidated Entities (other than such Unconsolidated Joint Venture) and (iii)&nbsp;is recourse only
to Retail Properties that secures such Debt. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Note</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a promissory note made by Borrower payable to the order of any Lender, in the amount of such Lender's Commitment, which
note is substantially in the form of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Notice of Borrowing</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;2.1.3.1. </FONT></P>

Documents due or to become due to the Lender Parties or any Person entitled to indemnification, or any of their respective successors, transferees or assigns, whether for principal, interest, letter

barred by a statute of limitations or such obligation or liability may otherwise be unenforceable. </FONT></P>

(ii)&nbsp;marketable direct obligations issued by any state of the United States or any political subdivision of any such state or any public instrumentality thereof maturing within one year from
the date of acquisition thereof and having, at the time of acquisition, the highest rating obtainable from either Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's Ratings Group, a division of The McGraw-Hill
Companies, or Moody's, (iii)&nbsp;commercial paper having, at the time of acquisition, the highest rating obtainable from either S&amp;P or Moody's, (iv)&nbsp;certificates of deposit, other time
deposits, and bankers' acceptances maturing within one year from the date of acquisition thereof issued by any bank operating under the laws of the United States or any state thereof or the District
of Columbia that has combined capital and surplus of not less than $500,000,000, (v)&nbsp;institutional money market funds organized under the laws of the United States of America or any state
thereof that invest solely in any of the Investments permitted under the foregoing clauses (i), (ii), (iii)&nbsp;and (iv)&nbsp;or (vi)&nbsp;Capital Stock that is (x)&nbsp;traded on a national
securities exchange, (y)&nbsp;purchased in the secondary market and (z)&nbsp;not subject to any legal or contractual restrictions on transferability. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;water

by reason of the failure to pay an imposition timely; and </FONT></P>

bank or other monetary authority charged with the interpretation or administration thereof, in each case after the date hereof, or (iii)&nbsp;compliance after the date hereof by the Lender (or its
Applicable Lending Office or any holding company of the Lender) with, any interpretation, directive, request, order or decree (whether or not having the force of law) of any such Governmental
Authority, central bank or other monetary authority. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

for loans and obligations making reference to a LIBO Rate for a Fixed Rate Period or time remaining in a Fixed Rate Period on a Price Adjustment Date, as appropriate. The Reserve Percentage shall be

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

Unsecured Debt of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities (other than the Permitted Subordinated Debentures) exceeding 68.97% of the aggregate Unencumbered Asset Value. </FONT></P>

Retail Property over (ii)&nbsp;the aggregate outstanding amount of Debt secured by a Lien on such Retail Property, in each case, as determined as of the end of the most recently ended Measuring
Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

which the Borrower or the Consolidated Entity does not have unrestricted access and unrestricted right to expend such cash or expend or liquidate such Permitted Investments. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Restricted Payment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means (i)&nbsp;any dividend or other distribution, direct or indirect, on account of any Capital Stock of the
Borrower, the REIT or any Subsidiary now or hereafter outstanding, except (a)&nbsp;a dividend or other distribution payable solely in shares of Capital Stock of the Borrower, the REIT or such
Subsidiary, as the case may be, and (b)&nbsp;the issuance of equity interests upon the exercise of outstanding warrants, options or other rights, or (ii)&nbsp;any redemption, retirement, sinking
fund or similar payment, purchase or other acquisition for value, direct or indirect, of any Capital Stock of the Borrower, the REIT or any Subsidiary now or hereafter outstanding. It is understood
that the conversion of any Capital Stock of the Borrower into Capital Stock of the REIT shall not constitute a Restricted Payment by the Borrower. </FONT></P>

Retail Property is not substantially complete. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

Directors, the President, the Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Operating Officer, the Chief Financial Officer, the Treasurer, the General Counsel or any Vice President in charge of a principal
business unit or division of such Borrower Party. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

for the Fiscal Quarter then most recently ended, to (ii)&nbsp;Interest Expense on all Unsecured Debt for such period (other than Interest Expense attributable to the Permitted Subordinated
Debentures). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT

whether any conditions to drawing could be met. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Subordinated Debt</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;6.9. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Subsidiary</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Person, any other Person of which more than 50% of the total voting power of the Capital Stock
entitled to vote in the election of the board of directors (or other Persons performing similar functions) are at the time directly or indirectly owned by such first Person. Unless otherwise
specified, the term "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subsidiary</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" refers to any Subsidiary of a Borrower Party. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>17</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=22,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=294577,FOLIO='17',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KK1261A.;6',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1261_1_18"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>S&amp;P</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's Ratings Services, a division of the McGraw-Hill Companies,&nbsp;Inc., or any
successor. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Tangible Net Worth</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, (i)&nbsp;Net Worth </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>minus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
(ii)&nbsp;Intangible Assets, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (iii)&nbsp;solely for purposes of Section&nbsp;7.3.1., any minority interest reflected in the balance sheet of
the REIT, but only to the extent attributable to Minority Interests, in each case at such time. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Tax Expense</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means (without duplication), for any period, total tax expense (if any) attributable to income and franchise taxes based
on or measured by income, whether paid or accrued, of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities, including the REIT's and Consolidated Entity's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
share of tax expenses in the Unconsolidated Joint Venture. For purposes of this definition, the REIT's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of any such tax expense of any
Unconsolidated Joint Venture shall be deemed equal to the product of (i)&nbsp;such tax expense of such Unconsolidated Joint Venture, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
(ii)&nbsp;the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock of such Person held by the REIT or any Consolidated Entity, expressed as a decimal. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Taxes</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, collectively, all withholdings, interest equalization taxes, stamp taxes or other taxes (except income and franchise
taxes) imposed by any domestic or foreign Governmental Authority and related in any manner to a Fixed Rate. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Third Person</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the definition of "Controlled Consolidated Entity" in this Section&nbsp;1.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Total Liabilities</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time, without duplication, the aggregate amount of (i)&nbsp;all Debt and other liabilities of the
Borrower and the Consolidated Entities reflected in the financial statements of the REIT or disclosed in the financial notes thereto, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
(ii)&nbsp;all liabilities of all Unconsolidated Joint Ventures that is otherwise recourse to the Borrower or any Consolidated Entity or any of its assets or that otherwise constitutes Debt of the
Borrower or any Consolidated Entity, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (iii)&nbsp;the Borrower's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of all Debt and
other liabilities of any Unconsolidated Joint Venture not otherwise constituting Debt of or recourse to the Borrower or any Consolidated Entity or any of its assets, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (iv)&nbsp;all liabilities of
the Borrower and the Consolidated Entities with respect to purchase and repurchase obligations, provided that such
obligations to acquire fully-constructed Retail Property shall not be included in Total Liabilities prior to the transfer of title of such Retail Property. For the purposes of clause&nbsp;(i), with
respect to any Retail Property Under Construction as to which the Borrower or any Consolidated Entity has provided an outstanding and undrawn letter of credit relating to the performance and/or
completion of construction at such property, the amount of Debt incurred by the Borrower or any Consolidated Entity to fund construction with respect to any such Retail Property Under Construction, to
the extent not exceeding the amount of the applicable letter of credit and in an amount not to exceed $25,000,000 in the aggregate at any time, shall not be included. For purposes of
clause&nbsp;(iii), the Borrower's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of all Debt and other liabilities of any Unconsolidated Joint Venture shall be deemed equal to the
product of (a)&nbsp;such Debt or other liabilities, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (b)&nbsp;the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock of such Person held
by the Borrower or any Consolidated Entity, expressed as a decimal. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Transferred Participations</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in the Recitals. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Unconsolidated Joint Venture</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means (i)&nbsp;any Joint Venture of the REIT or any Consolidated Entity in which the REIT or such
Consolidated Entity holds any Capital Stock but which would not be combined with the REIT in the consolidated financial statements of the REIT in accordance with GAAP, and (ii)&nbsp;any Investment
of the REIT or any Consolidated Entity in any Person that is not a Joint Venture. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Unencumbered Asset</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, subject to Section&nbsp;4.3., any Real Property that satisfies all of the following conditions: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;is
a neighborhood, community and regional shopping center or mall; </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>18</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=23,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=86608,FOLIO='18',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KK1261A.;6',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1261_1_19"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;is Wholly-Owned, free and clear of any Lien on such Real Property or the Person holding title to such Real Property (unless approved in writing by the Required
Lenders in their discretion) (other than (a)&nbsp;easements, covenants, and other restrictions, charges or encumbrances not securing Debt that do not interfere materially with the ordinary
operations of the property and do not materially detract from the value of the property; (b)&nbsp;building restrictions, zoning laws and other Applicable Laws, and (c)&nbsp;leases and subleases of
the property in the ordinary course of business, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that any such Liens under (c)&nbsp;that are ground leases entered into after the Closing
Date or that are ground leases with respect to Real Properties that become part of the Unencumbered Pool after the Closing Date shall have been approved by the Required Lenders in their discretion); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;in
the case of any Real Property title to which is not held directly by the Borrower, (a)&nbsp;the Subsidiary holding title to such Real Property is a Guarantor
or becomes a Guarantor prior to the Real Property being treated as an Unencumbered Asset for purposes of determining the Unencumbered Pool, (b)&nbsp;the Capital Stock of such Subsidiary is not
subject to any Lien, and (c)&nbsp;such Subsidiary delivers to the Agent (1)&nbsp;an opinion of counsel, substantially in the form delivered to the Agent pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1 and by
counsel reasonably acceptable to the Agent, with respect to the matters covered by the closing opinion delivered pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1 with respect to the Initial Guarantors, and (2)&nbsp;a
copy of the charter documents of the Subsidiary, as in effect at that time; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;unless
waived by the Agent, a title report from a title company of national repute for such Real Property is delivered to the Agent showing that no material
defects exist in or with respect to title to the Real Property (other than Liens permitted to exist pursuant to clause&nbsp;(ii)); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;unless
waived by the Required Lenders, a Phase I environmental study for such Real Property is delivered to the Agent showing that no material adverse environmental
conditions exist on or with respect to the Real Property; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;not
less than 75% of the M&amp;F Gross Leaseable Area of any Real Property included in the Unencumbered Pool shall be subject to a lease or a sublease pursuant to
which rent is being paid by the tenant thereunder; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;the
Real Property has been otherwise expressly approved by the Required Lenders in writing as eligible for inclusion in the Unencumbered Pool in their discretion;
and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii)&nbsp;the
Real Property has been designated by the Borrower as an Unencumbered Asset. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless
the Borrower shall have notified the Agent and the Lenders to the contrary, the Real Properties listed as "Unencumbered Assets" in the Compliance Certificate most recently
delivered to the Agent pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.1.3, shall be considered designated by the Borrower as Unencumbered Assets pursuant to clause&nbsp;(viii) above. As of the date hereof, all of the
Real Properties that have been approved by the Required Lenders as eligible for inclusion in the Unencumbered Pool and designated by the Borrower as Unencumbered Assets pursuant to clauses
(vii)&nbsp;and (viii)&nbsp;above, respectively, are set forth on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1C</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. If any Unencumbered Asset (including any of the properties
listed on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1C</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>) no longer satisfies the conditions of the foregoing clauses (ii), (iii)&nbsp;or (vi), at the direction of the Required
Lenders, the Agent shall notify the Borrower that, effective upon the giving of such notice, such asset shall no longer be considered an Unencumbered Asset (irrespective of whether a Default or Event
of Default exists at that time or results therefrom). If the Borrower intends to designate a property as an Unencumbered Asset to be added to the Unencumbered Pool from time to time (other than those
listed on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1.1C</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), it will notify the Agent and the Lenders of such intention, which notice will include (a)&nbsp;a physical description
of the property to be added to the Unencumbered Pool, including its age and location and, if requested by the Agent, a recent title report, (b)&nbsp;if title to the property is held by a
Consolidated Entity other than the Borrower, the names and respective percentage interests of all Persons holding Capital Stock of such Consolidated Entity, </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>19</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=24,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=799461,FOLIO='19',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KK1261A.;6',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1261_1_20"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
(c)&nbsp;information regarding the occupancy of the property (a rent roll), (d)&nbsp;operating statements for the most recent Fiscal Quarter and the most recent Fiscal Year (and the previous
Fiscal Year, if available) and (e)&nbsp;an operating budget for the current Fiscal Year. The property shall become part of the Unencumbered Pool upon the written approval of the Required Lenders. If
the Borrower at any time intends to withdraw any Real Property from the Unencumbered Pool, it shall (i)&nbsp;notify the Agent and the Lenders of its intention, and (ii)&nbsp;deliver to the Agent
and the Lenders a certificate of its chief financial officer setting forth the calculations establishing that the Borrower will be in compliance with Section&nbsp;7.4. with giving effect to such
withdrawal (and any concurrent addition of properties to the Unencumbered Pool), which calculations shall be substantially in the form of the calculations in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;C-4</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> relating to Section
&nbsp;7.4. Effective automatically upon delivery of such notice and certificate by the Borrower,
(i)&nbsp;such property shall no longer constitute an Unencumbered Asset and (ii)&nbsp;if title to the property that is being released from the Unencumbered Pool is not held directly by the
Borrower and the Consolidated Entity holding title to such property holds title to no other Unencumbered Asset, such Consolidated Entity shall be released from the Guaranty, and shall cease to be a
Guarantor hereunder, in each case without any further action by the Agent or any Lender. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Unencumbered Asset Value</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any time: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;with
respect to any specified Unencumbered Asset other than the Unencumbered Assets described in clauses (ii)&nbsp;or (iv)&nbsp;below, for each such property,
(a)&nbsp;the product of such property's Property NOI for the Measuring Period </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>divided by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (b)&nbsp;9.50% (expressed as a decimal); </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;with
respect to any specified Unencumbered Asset that is a regional Retail Property other than a regional Retail Property described in clause&nbsp;(iv) below,
for each such property, (a)&nbsp;the product of such property's Property NOI for the Measuring Period, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>divided by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (b)&nbsp;8.25% (expressed as a
decimal); </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;all
cash and Permitted Investments (other than, in either case, Restricted Cash) held by the Consolidated Entities at such time, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> in the case of cash and Permitted Investments not Wholly-Owned,
a percentage (expressed as a decimal) equal to the percentage of the total
outstanding Capital Stock held by the Borrower of the Consolidated Entity holding title to such cash and Permitted Investments; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;(iv)(a)&nbsp;50%
of Construction-in-Process with respect to Retail Properties in the Unencumbered Pool that are Wholly-Owned and are Unencumbered
Assets and (b)&nbsp;the product of (1)&nbsp;50% of Construction-in-Process with respect to Retail Properties in the Unencumbered Pool that are not Wholly-Owned </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>multiplied by</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (2)&nbsp;a percentage
(expressed as a decimal) equal to the percentage of the total outstanding Capital Stock held by the Borrower of
the Consolidated Entity holding title to such Retail Properties in the Unencumbered Pool; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that the Unencumbered Asset Value included in
this clause&nbsp;(iv) shall not constitute more than 10% percent of the total Unencumbered
Asset Value. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Unencumbered Pool</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the pool of Unencumbered Assets. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Unsecured Debt</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Debt that is not secured by (i)&nbsp;a first priority Lien on Real Property of a Borrower Party,
(ii)&nbsp;a Lien on office machines, (iii)&nbsp;a Lien on automobiles, (iv)&nbsp;a Lien on personal property held at the property level used in the ongoing operation of any Retail Property or
(v)&nbsp;a second priority Lien on Real Property of a Borrower Party, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that with respect to any Real Property that is the subject of a second
priority Lien (a)&nbsp;such Real Property is owned by a Bankruptcy Remote Entity, (b)&nbsp;the Debt secured by the second priority Lien on such Real Property is non-recourse to the
Borrower and (c)&nbsp;the sum of (x)&nbsp;the Debt secured by the first priority Lien on such Real Property and (y)&nbsp;the Debt that is secured by the second priority Lien on such Real
Property does not exceed 85% of the Gross Asset Value of such Real Property. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>20</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=25,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=493768,FOLIO='20',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KK1261A.;6',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1261_1_21"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Wholly-Owned</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to any Real Property or other asset owned or leased, that (i)&nbsp;title to such asset is held
directly by, or such asset is leased by, the Borrower, or (ii)&nbsp;in the case of Real Property, title to such property is held by, or such property is leased by, a Consolidated Entity at least 99%
of the Capital Stock of which is held of record and beneficially by the Borrower and the balance of the Capital Stock of which (if any) is held of record and beneficially by the REIT (or any wholly-
owned Subsidiary of the REIT). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Wholly-Owned Entity</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" is defined in Section&nbsp;7.2.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 1.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Related Matters.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Construction.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless the context of this Agreement clearly requires
otherwise, references to the plural include the singular, the singular includes the plural, the part includes the whole, "including" is not limiting, and "or" has the inclusive meaning represented by
the phrase "and/or." The words "hereof," "herein," "hereby," "hereunder" and similar terms in this Agreement refer to this Agreement as a whole (including the Preamble, the Recitals, the Schedules and
the Exhibits) and not to any particular provision of this Agreement. Article, section, subsection, exhibit, schedule, recital and preamble references in this Agreement are to this Agreement unless
otherwise specified. References in this Agreement to any agreement, other document or law "as amended" or "as amended from time to time," or to amendments of any document or law, shall include any
amendments, supplements, replacements, renewals, waivers or other modifications. References in this Agreement to any law (or
any part thereof) include any rules and regulations promulgated thereunder (or with respect to such part) by the relevant Governmental Authority, as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Determinations.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Any determination or calculation contemplated by this
Agreement that is made by any Lender Party shall be final and conclusive and binding upon each Borrower Party, and, in the case of determinations by the Agent, also the other Lender Parties, in the
absence of manifest error. References in this Agreement to any "determination" by any Lender Party include good faith estimates by such Lender Party (in the case of quantitative determinations), and
good faith beliefs by such Lender Party (in the case of qualitative determinations). All references herein to "discretion" of any Lender Party (or terms of similar import) shall mean "absolute and
sole discretion." All consents and other actions of any Lender Party contemplated by this Agreement may be given, taken, withheld or not taken in such Lender Party's discretion (whether or not so
expressed), except as otherwise expressly provided herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.3.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Accounting Terms and Determinations.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise specified herein,
all accounting terms used herein shall be interpreted, all accounting determinations hereunder shall be made, and all financial statements required to be delivered hereunder shall be prepared on a
consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP applied on a basis consistent (except for changes that the independent public accountants of the REIT deem necessary in order to allow them to render an
unqualified opinion to the REIT and for changes that are not deemed so necessary but are concurred in by such independent public accountants and the Agent) with the audited consolidated financial
statements of the REIT and the Consolidated Entities referred to in Section&nbsp;5.6.1. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, for purposes of determining the REIT's </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of any
income, expense, asset, liability or other item of or with respect to any Unconsolidated Joint Venture, as used in the defined
terms used in or by reference in Section&nbsp;7.3., the percentage of the Capital Stock held by the REIT or any Consolidated Entity shall be the percentage required to be used under GAAP. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.4.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED BY, AND CONSTRUED IN
ACCORDANCE WITH, THE LAWS (OTHER THAN THE RULES REGARDING CONFLICTS OF LAWS, EXCEPT THOSE CONTAINED IN CALIFORNIA CIVIL CODE SECTION 1646.5) OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>21</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=26,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=517584,FOLIO='21',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]KK1261B.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:16' -->
<A NAME="page_kk1261_1_22"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.5.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Headings.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Article and Section headings used in this Agreement are
for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.6.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Severability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;If any provision of this Agreement shall be held to be
invalid, illegal or unenforceable under Applicable Law in any jurisdiction, such provision shall be ineffective only to the extent of such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability, which shall not
affect any other provisions hereof or the validity, legality or enforceability of such provision in any other jurisdiction. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.7.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Independence of Covenants.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;All covenants under this Agreement shall each
be given independent effect so that if a particular action or condition is not permitted by any such covenant, the fact that it would be permitted by another covenant, by an exception thereto, or be
otherwise within the limitations thereof, shall not avoid the occurrence of a Default or an Event of Default if such action is taken or condition exists. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2.8.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Definitions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Terms otherwise defined in Preamble, the Recitals and
in any other provision of this Agreement or any of the other Loan Documents not defined or referenced in Section&nbsp;1.1. have their respective defined meanings when used herein or therein. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk1261_article_2._amount_and_terms_of_the_credit_facilities"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk1261_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE 2.<BR>  <BR>    AMOUNT AND TERMS OF THE CREDIT FACILITIES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 2.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Advances.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Advances.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in this
Agreement, (a)&nbsp;on the Closing Date, the Existing Credit Agreement is hereby superseded, amended and restated in its entirety, and (b)&nbsp;each Lender hereby severally agrees, at any time
from and after the Closing Date until the Business Day next preceding the Maturity Date, to make advances (each an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Advance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>," which term shall also
include amounts drawn under Letters of Credit pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.2.4.1.) to the Borrower in an aggregate outstanding principal amount not to exceed at any time outstanding, when added to
other Commitment Usage of such Lender at such time, the Commitment of such Lender, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that the Commitment Usage of all Lenders at any time, in the
aggregate, shall not exceed the aggregate Commitments of all Lenders; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, further</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that with respect to any Residual Advance, (i)&nbsp;the
aggregate amount of all outstanding Residual Advances shall not exceed the lesser of (A)&nbsp;$50,000,000 and (B)&nbsp;25.0% of the aggregate Residual Value of all Wholly-Owned Retail Properties
and (ii)&nbsp;no principal amount of a Residual Advance shall remain outstanding more than 210&nbsp;days after the earlier of (x)&nbsp;the Funding Date of such Residual Advance and
(y)&nbsp;the Funding Date of the earliest Residual Advance outstanding at the time such Residual Advance is made (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Residual Advance Maturity
Date</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). Advances may be voluntarily prepaid and, subject to the provisions of this Agreement
(including Section&nbsp;2.13.), any amounts so prepaid may be re-borrowed, up to the amount available under this Section&nbsp;2.1.1. at the time of such re-borrowing. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Type of Advances and Minimum Amounts.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Advances made under this
Section&nbsp;2.1. may be Base Rate Advances or Fixed Rate Advances, subject, however, to Section&nbsp;2.4. Each Borrowing of Fixed Rate Advances to which the same Fixed Rate Period is applicable
shall be in a minimum amount of $2,000,000 and integral multiples of $1,000,000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.3.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notice of Borrowing.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1.3.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;When the Borrower desires to borrow pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.1., it shall deliver to the
Agent, (i)&nbsp;in the case of an Advance other than a Residual Advance, a Notice of Borrowing substantially in the form of </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;B-1A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and a Borrowing Certificate substantially in the form of
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;B-2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Borrowing Certificate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") or (ii)&nbsp;in the case of a Residual
Advance, a Notice of Borrowing substantially in the form of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit&nbsp;B-1B</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and a Borrowing Certificate, in each case, duly completed
and executed by a Responsible Officer (each Notice of Borrowing delivered pursuant to </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>22</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
clause&nbsp;(i) and (ii)&nbsp;above, a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Notice of Borrowing</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), no later than 10:00&nbsp;a.m. (California time) (i)&nbsp;at least one Business
Day before (or, if the Agent Bank is the sole Lender hereunder at such time, on) the proposed Funding Date, in the case of a Base Rate Advance, or (ii)&nbsp;at least three Business Days (or, if the
Agent Bank is the sole Lender hereunder at such time, one Business Day), but not more than five Business Days, before the proposed Funding Date, in the case of a Fixed Rate Advance. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1.3.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;In lieu of delivering a Notice of Borrowing for an Advance (other than with respect to a
Residual Advance), the Borrower, through a Responsible Officer, may give the Agent telephonic notice by the required time of the proposed borrowing for Advances of that type and all information
required by a Notice of Borrowing; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that such notice shall be confirmed in writing by delivery of a Notice of Borrowing by fax to the
Agent as soon as practicable one day prior to the proposed Funding Date. The Lender Parties shall incur no liability to the Borrower in acting upon any telephonic notice that the Agent believes to
have been given by a Person authorized to act on behalf of the Borrower or for otherwise acting in good faith under this Section&nbsp;2.1. and in making any Advance in accordance with this Agreement
pursuant to any telephonic notice. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1.3.3.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, no Notice of Borrowing shall be required at
any time while the Agent Bank is the only Lender hereunder with respect to any Base Rate Advance while there shall be in effect, pursuant to subsequent mutual agreement between the Borrower and the
Agent Bank, a program (such as a credit sweep) whereby Base Rate Advances are made automatically to maintain a target balance in an account the Borrower maintains with the Agent Bank (a
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Credit Sweep Program</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). The Agent Bank shall incur no liability to the Borrower making Advances pursuant to any Credit Sweep Program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1.3.4.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Agent shall promptly notify each Lender of the contents of any Notice of Borrowing (or
telephonic notice in lieu thereof) received by it and such Lender's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> portion of the Borrowing of Advances requested. Not later than
9:00&nbsp;a.m. (California time) on the date specified in such notice as the Funding Date, each Lender, subject to the terms and conditions hereof, shall make its </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro
rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> portion of the Borrowing of Advances available, in immediately available funds, to the Agent at the Agent's Account. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.4.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Funding of Advances.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to and upon satisfaction of the applicable
conditions set forth in Article&nbsp;4. as determined by the Agent, the Agent shall make the proceeds of the requested Advances available to the Borrower in Dollars in immediately available funds in
the Borrower Account. In addition, if the Borrower Account is maintained with a financial institution other than the Agent, all borrowings hereunder shall be subject to the terms and conditions of the
Funds Transfer Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1.5.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Responsible Officers With Respect to Advances.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1.5.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Borrower shall notify the Agent of the names of its officers and employees authorized to
request and take other actions with respect to Advances on behalf of the Borrower (each a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Responsible Officer</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and shall provide the Agent with a
specimen signature of each such officer or employee. The Agent shall be entitled to rely conclusively on a Responsible Officer's authority to request and take other actions (including any Notices of
Borrowing or telephonic notice in lieu thereof, notices pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.4.2., or acceptance of telephonic quotes of Fixed Rates given by the Lender pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.4.2.,)
with respect to Advances on behalf of the Borrower until the Agent receives written notice to the contrary. The Agent shall have no duty to verify the authenticity of the signature appearing on any
Notice of Borrowing or any other certificate or notice delivered pursuant to this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section 2.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Letters of Credit.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;In General.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in
this Agreement, at any time from and after the Closing Date until the day that is thirty (30)&nbsp;days prior to the Maturity Date, the Agent Bank shall issue for the account of the Borrower one or
more Letters of Credit, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that (a)&nbsp;the aggregate Stated Amount of all outstanding Letters of Credit shall not exceed $20,000,000,
(b)&nbsp;the Stated Amount of the proposed Letter of Credit, when added to other Commitment Usage of all Lenders at such time, in the aggregate, shall not exceed the aggregate Commitments of all
Lenders, and (c)&nbsp;in no event shall Letters of Credit be issued for the benefit of any of the Lenders. Letters of Credit shall have expiry dates not later than 24&nbsp;months from the date of
issuance and in any event not later than 10 Business Days prior to the Maturity Date. No Letter of Credit shall contain an automatic renewal or extension clause. The provisions of this
Section&nbsp;2.2. and Section&nbsp;4.2. shall apply to any supplement, amendment, extension, renewal or increase of a Letter of Credit as if it were a new Letter of Credit. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Issuances of Letters of Credit.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;When the Borrower desires the issuance
of a Letter of Credit, the Borrower shall deliver to the Agent Bank at least five (5)&nbsp;Business Days before the Funding Date, a Letter of Credit Agreement and such other documents and materials
as may be required by the Agent Bank, each in form and substance satisfactory to the Agent Bank. The Agent Bank shall, if it approves of the contents of the Letter of Credit Agreement and such other
documents and materials, and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, issue the Letter of Credit on or before 5:00&nbsp;p.m. (California time) on or before the day that is five
(5)&nbsp;Business Days following the receipt of all documents required under this Section&nbsp;2.2.2. In the event of a conflict between the terms of any Letter of Credit Agreement and this
Agreement, the terms of this Agreement shall govern. Upon issuance of a Letter of Credit, the Agent shall promptly notify each Lender thereof and of such Lender's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro
rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of such Letter of Credit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.3.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Participations in Letters of Credit.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediately upon the issuance of a
Letter of Credit (other than the Existing Letters of Credit), each Lender (other than the Agent Bank) shall be deemed to have irrevocably purchased from the Agent Bank a participation in such Letter
of Credit and any drawing thereunder in an amount equal to such Lender's </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> share of the Stated Amount of such Letter of Credit. An amount equal
to the Letter of Credit Liability for each Letter of Credit shall be reserved under the Commitments and shall not be available for borrowing for any purpose other than reimbursement of amounts drawn
under the Letters of Credit pursuant to the terms of this Section&nbsp;2.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2.4.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Drawings, Etc.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any provisions to the contrary in any
Letter of Credit Agreement: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.2.4.1.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;In case of a drawing under any Letter of Credit, the amounts so drawn shall, from the date of
payment thereof by the Agent Bank, be deemed to be an Advance by the Agent Bank, as a Lender, and, to the extent reimbursed pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.2.4.2., Advances by the other Lenders, for all
purposes hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.2.4.2.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Promptly after payment by the Agent Bank of any amount drawn under any Letter of Credit, the
Agent shall notify each Lender of the amount of such drawing and of such Lender's respective participation therein. Each Lender shall make available to the Agent Bank an amount equal to its respective
participation in immediately available funds, at the office of such Agent Bank specified in such notice, not later than the Business Day after the date on which the Agent gives such notice. Each
Lender's obligations under this Section&nbsp;2.2.4.2. (a)&nbsp;shall not be subject to any set-off, counterclaim or defense to payment that the Lender may have against any Borrower
Party or against the Agent Bank and (b)&nbsp;shall be absolute, unconditional and irrevocable, and as a </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
