relates. The exercisability period of a SAR shall not exceed that provided in the related Award Agreement, and the SAR shall expire at the end of such exercisability period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Other Awards</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The Committee shall establish in respect of each other Award granted hereunder the Participant's rights and benefits
(if any) in the event of a Termination of Employment and in so doing may make distinctions based upon, among other factions, the cause of termination and the nature of the Award.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Extension of Exercise</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions but subject to Section&nbsp;6.2, in the event of, or in
anticipation of, a Termination of Employment with the Company, the Committee may, in its discretion, increase the portion of the Award available to the Participant (or Participant's Beneficiary or
Personal Representative, as the case may be) or extend the exercisability period upon such terms as the Committee shall determine. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.4</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Compliance With Laws.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan, the granting and vesting of Awards under
this Plan and the offer, issuance and delivery of shares of Common Stock and/or the payment of money under this Plan or under Awards granted hereunder are subject to compliance with all applicable
federal and state laws, rules and regulations (including but not limited to state and federal securities law and federal margin requirements) and to such approvals by any listing, agency or any
regulatory or governmental authority as may, in the opinion of counsel for the Corporation, be necessary or advisable in connection therewith. Any securities delivered under this Plan shall be subject
to such restrictions, and the person acquiring such securities shall, if requested by the Corporation, provide such assurances and representations to the Corporation as the Corporation may deem
necessary or desirable to assure compliance with all applicable legal requirements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.5</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax Withholding.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon any exercise, vesting, or payment of any Award or
upon the disposition of shares of Common Stock acquired pursuant to the exercise of an Incentive Stock Option prior to satisfaction of the holding period requirements of Section&nbsp;422 of the
Code, the Company shall have the right at its option to (i)&nbsp;require the Participant (or the Participant's Personal Representative or Beneficiary, as the case may be) to pay or provide for
payment of the amount of any taxes which the Company may be required to withhold with respect to such transaction or (ii)&nbsp;deduct from any amount payable the amount of any taxes which the
Company may be required to withhold with respect to such cash amount. In any case where a tax is required to be withheld in connection with the delivery of shares of Common Stock under this Plan, the
Committee may permit the Participant to elect, pursuant to such rules and subject to such conditions as the Committee may establish, to have the Corporation </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>15</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_li1261_1_16"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
reduce the number of shares to be delivered by (or otherwise reacquire) the appropriate number of shares valued at their then Fair Market Value, to satisfy such withholding obligation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.6</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan Amendment, Termination and Suspension.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Board or Committee Authorization</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The Board may, at any time, terminate or, from time to time, amend, modify or suspend this Plan, in
whole or in part. No Awards may be granted during any suspension of this Plan or after termination of this Plan, but the Committee shall retain jurisdiction as to Awards then outstanding in accordance
with the terms of this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Amendments to Awards</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Without limiting any other express authority of the Committee under but subject to the express limits of this
Plan (including Section&nbsp;6.2(c)), the Board or the Committee, by agreement or resolution, may waive conditions of or limitations on Awards to Eligible Persons that the Committee in the prior
exercise of its discretion has imposed, without the consent of a Participant, and may make other changes to the terms and conditions of Awards that do not affect, in any manner materially adverse to
the Employee Participant, his or her rights and benefits under an Award.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Limitations on Amendments to Plan and Awards</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. No amendment, suspension or termination of this Plan or change of or affecting any
outstanding Award shall, without written consent of the Participant, affect in any manner materially adverse to the Participant any rights or benefits of the Participant or
obligations of the Corporation under any Award granted under this Plan prior to the effective date of such change. Changes contemplated by Section&nbsp;6.2 shall not be deemed to constitute changes
or amendments for purposes of this Section&nbsp;6.6. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.7</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Privileges of Stock Ownership.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise expressly authorized by
the Committee or this Plan, a Participant shall not be entitled to any privilege of stock ownership as to any shares of Common Stock not actually delivered to and held of record by him or her. No
adjustment will be made for dividends or other rights as a stockholder for which a record date is prior to such date of delivery. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.8</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective Date of This Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The effective date of this Plan is
November&nbsp;9, 2000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.9</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Term of This Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;No Award shall be granted after November&nbsp;8, 2010
(the "Termination Date"). Unless otherwise expressly provided in this Plan or in an applicable Award Agreement, any Award theretofore granted may extend beyond such date, and all authority of the
Committee with respect to Awards hereunder, including its authority to amend an Award, shall continue during any suspension of this Plan and in respect of outstanding Awards on such Termination Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.10</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law/Construction/Severability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Choice of Law</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Plan, the Awards, all documents evidencing Awards and all other related documents shall be governed by, and
construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Maryland.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Severability</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. If any non-essential provision shall be held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid and
unenforceable, the remaining provisions of this Plan shall continue in effect.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Plan Construction; Bifurcation</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Plan, the provisions of this Plan may at any time be
bifurcated by the Board or the Committee in any manner so that certain provisions of any Award Agreement (or this Plan) intended (or required in order) to satisfy the applicable requirements of
Rule&nbsp;16b-3 or to qualify for exemption from the limit on deductibility under Section&nbsp;162(m) (to the extent permitted thereby) are applicable only to persons subject to those
provisions and to those Awards to those persons intended to satisfy the requirements of the applicable rule or rules thereunder. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.11</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Captions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Captions and headings are given to the sections and subsections
of this Plan solely as a convenience to facilitate reference. Such headings shall not be deemed in any way material or relevant to the construction or interpretation of this Plan or any provision
thereof. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>16</FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_li1261_1_17"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.12</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-Exclusivity of Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing in this Plan shall limit or
be deemed to limit the authority of the Board or the Committee to grant awards or authorize any other compensation, with or without reference to the Common Stock, under any other plan or authority. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>VII.&nbsp;&nbsp;DEFINITIONS.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Award"
shall mean an award of any Option, SAR, Stock Unit, Restricted Stock, Stock Bonus, DER, or any combination thereof, whether alternative or cumulative, authorized by and
granted under this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Award
Agreement" shall mean any writing setting forth the terms of an Award that has been authorized by the Committee and until changed by the Committee shall be substantially in
the form of the most recent Award Agreements for the specific type of Award authorized by the Committee under the Corporation's Amended and Restated 1994 Incentive Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Award
Date" shall mean the date upon which the Committee took the action granting an Award or such later date as the Committee designates as the Award Date at the time of the
Award.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Award
Period" shall mean the period beginning on an Award Date and ending on the expiration date of such Award.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Beneficial
Ownership" shall mean ownership of Equity Shares by a person who would be treated as an owner of such shares either directly or indirectly through the application of
Section&nbsp;544 of the Code, as modified by Section&nbsp;856(h)(1)(B) of the Code. The terms "Beneficial Owner," "Beneficially Owns" and "Beneficially Owned" shall have correlative meanings.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(f)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Beneficiary"
shall mean the person, persons, trust or trusts entitled by will or the laws of descent and distribution to receive the benefits specified in the Award Agreement and
under this Plan in the event of a Participant's death, and shall mean the Participant's executor or administrator if no other Beneficiary is identified and able to act under the circumstances.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(g)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Board"
shall mean the Board of Directors of the Corporation.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(h)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Change
in Control Event" shall mean any of the following:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Approval
by the stockholders of the Corporation of the dissolution or liquidation of the Corporation;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Approval
by the stockholders of the Corporation of an agreement to merge or consolidate, or otherwise reorganize, with or into one or more entities that are not Subsidiaries or
other affiliates, as a result of which less than 50% of the outstanding voting securities of the surviving or resulting entity immediately after the reorganization are, or will be, owned, directly or
indirectly, by stockholders or other affiliates of the Corporation immediately before such reorganization (assuming for purposes of such determination that there is no change in the record ownership
of the Corporation's securities from the record date for such approval until such reorganization but including in such determination any securities of the other parties to such reorganization held by
affiliates of the Corporation);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(3)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Approval
by the stockholders of the Corporation of the sale of substantially all of the Corporation's business and/or assets to a person or entity which is not a Subsidiary or other
affiliate; or </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>17</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=17,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=396954,FOLIO='17',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LI1261A.;17',USER='DMALONE',CD='27-MAR-2001;22:48' -->
<A NAME="page_li1261_1_18"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(4)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
"person" (as such term is used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) of the Exchange Act) becomes the "beneficial owner" (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Exchange
Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Corporation representing more than 20% of the combined voting power of the Corporation's then outstanding securities entitled to then vote generally
in the election of directors of the Corporation. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Code"
shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(j)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Commission"
shall mean the Securities and Exchange Commission.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(k)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Committee"
shall mean a committee appointed by the Board to administer this Plan, which committee shall be comprised of at least two Board members or such greater number of
directors as may be required under applicable law, each of whom, during such time as one or more Participants may be subject to Section&nbsp;16 of the Exchange Act, shall be a Disinterested
Director.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(l)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Common
Stock" shall mean the Common Stock of the Corporation and such other securities or property as may become the subject of Awards, or become subject to Awards, pursuant to an
adjustment made under Section&nbsp;6.2 of this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(m)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Company"
shall mean, collectively, The Macerich Company and its Subsidiaries, and shall mean, individually, any one of them, as the context requires.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(n)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Constructive
Ownership" shall mean ownership of Equity Shares by a person who would be treated as an owner of such shares either directly or indirectly through the application of
Section&nbsp;318 of the Code, as modified by Section&nbsp;856(d)(5) of the Code. The terms "Constructive Owner," "Constructive Owns" and "Constructively Owned" shall have correlative meanings.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(o)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Corporation"
shall mean The Macerich Company, a Maryland corporation, and its successors.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(p)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Deferred
Stock Award" shall mean a deferred payment award payable in Common Stock or cash or other consideration, as determined by the Committee, based on Stock Units credited to a
Participant's Stock Unit Account.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(q)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Disability"
shall mean, in the case of an Incentive Stock Option, a "permanent and total disability" within the meaning of Section&nbsp;22(e)(3) of the Code and, in the case of
all other Awards, such other disabilities, infirmities, afflictions or conditions as the Committee by rule may include.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(r)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Disinterested
Director" shall mean (unless the Board otherwise determines) a member of the Board who is a Non-Employee Director as defined in
Rule&nbsp;16b-3 and an "outside director" as defined in regulations under Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Code, as each may be amended from time to time.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(s)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Dividend
Equivalent Right" shall mean a right authorized under Section&nbsp;5.4 of this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(t)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Eligible
Person" shall mean an officer (whether or not an employee), an employee of the Company, a director of the Company or any advisor or consultant who performs bona fide
substantial services for the Company, all as determined by the Committee in its discretion, except as otherwise limited for purposes of Sections 5.2(a) and 5.3(d). An advisor or consultant may not be
selected as an Eligible Person if such person's participation in this Plan, in light of the services performed or for other reasons, would adversely affect (1)&nbsp;the Corporation's eligibility to
use Form&nbsp;S-8 to register under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, the offering of Shares issuable under this Plan by the Corporation or (2)&nbsp;the Corporation's compliance
with any other applicable laws. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<UL>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(u)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Equity
Shares" shall mean shares that are either Common Stock or Preferred Stock.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(v)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"ERISA"
shall mean the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(w)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Exchange
Act" shall mean the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended from time to time.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(x)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Fair
Market Value" on any date shall mean the closing price of the stock on the Composite Tape, as published in the Western Edition of The Wall Street Journal, of the principal
securities exchange or market on which the stock is so listed, admitted to trade, or quoted on such date, or, if there is no trading of the stock on such date, then the closing price of the stock as
quoted on such Composite Tape on the next preceding date on which there was trading in such shares; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, if the stock is not so listed,
admitted or quoted, the Committee may designate such other exchange, market or source of data as it deems appropriate for determining such value for purposes of this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(y)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Incentive
Stock Option" shall mean an Option which is designated as an incentive stock option within the meaning of Section&nbsp;422 of the Code and which contains such
provisions as are necessary to comply with that section; provided however that no Incentive Stock Option may be granted unless stockholder approval of this Plan is obtained.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(z)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Nonqualified
Stock Option" shall mean an Option that is designated as a Nonqualified Option and shall include any Option intended as an Incentive Option that fails to meet the
applicable legal requirements thereof. Any Option granted hereunder that is not designated as an Incentive Stock Option shall be deemed to be designated a Nonqualified Stock Option under this Plan and
not an Incentive Share Option under the Code.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(aa)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Option"
shall mean an option to purchase Common Stock under this Plan. The Committee shall designate any Option granted to an Eligible Person as a Nonqualified Stock Option or an
Incentive Stock Option.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(bb)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Ownership
Limit" shall mean 9.8% of the value of the outstanding Equity Shares of the Corporation.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(cc)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Participant"
shall mean an Eligible Person who has been granted an Award under this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(dd)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Personal
Representative" shall mean the person or persons who, upon the disability or incompetence of a Participant, shall have acquired on behalf of the Participant, by legal
proceeding or otherwise, the power to exercise the rights or receive benefits under this Plan by virtue of having become the legal representative of the Participant.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(ee)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Plan"
shall mean The Macerich Company 2000 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended from time to time.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(ff)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Preferred
Stock" shall mean the Preferred Stock of the Corporation.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(gg)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Qualified
Performance-Based Award" shall mean a performance-based award under this Plan that is intended to satisfy the requirements of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Code in
respect of performance-based compensation, the payment of which is contingent upon attainment of performance objectives specified by the Committee in respect of the business criteria specified in
Section&nbsp;5.2, and the issuance or vesting of which may be subject to other restrictions or conditions.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(hh)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Restricted
Stock" shall mean shares of Common Stock awarded to a Participant pursuant to Article&nbsp;IV. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(oo)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Stock

Section&nbsp;5.3(c) and which is payable in cash, stock and/or other consideration as the Committee may determine.

shall mean The Macerich Partnership, L.P., a Delaware limited partnership, The Macerich Management Company, The Macerich Property Management Company, both California
corporations, or any corporation or other entity a majority of whose outstanding voting stock or voting power is beneficially owned directly or indirectly by the Corporation.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(rr)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>"Termination
of Employment" shall mean any termination of the Participant's employment with the Company; if an entity ceases to be a Subsidiary, a Termination of Employment shall
be deemed to have occurred with respect to each employee of such Subsidiary who does not continue as an employee of another entity owned, controlled by or under common control with the Company. The
Committee may provide generally or on a case-by-case basis on such conditions as it deems appropriate that a Termination of Employment does not occur if a person's status as an
employee terminates but his or her services continue as an officer or other person who would be eligible to participate in the Plan as an Other Eligible Person. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="li1261_exhibit_a"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_li1261_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT A    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PERFORMANCE-BASED BUSINESS CRITERIA  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Funds From Operations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means Funds from Operations, as defined by The National Association of Real Estate
Investment Trusts at the time of the grant of an Award, for the applicable period, as reflected in the Corporation's periodic financial reports for the period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Stock Appreciation</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an increase in the price or value of the Common Stock of the Corporation after the date of grant of an Award
and during the applicable period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Total Stockholder Return</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the aggregate Common Stock price appreciation and dividends paid (assuming full reinvestment of
dividends) during the applicable period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Occupancy Gains</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means increases in the occupancy level (leased and occupied areas) of malls and freestanding store area (excluding
Anchors) (owned at both the beginning and end of the applicable period) during the period, measured as a percentage of the gross leasable/occupiable area of such properties, as reported to the
Committee for inclusion in the Corporation's reports to the SEC for the applicable period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>EBITDA</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization for the applicable period, as reflected in the
Corporation's financial reports for the applicable period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Overall Square Footage Growth</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the increase, between the beginning and end of the applicable period, in the total square feet of
gross leasable mall and free standing stores area (excluding Anchors), as reported to the Committee for inclusion in the Corporation's reports to the SEC for the applicable period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except
as otherwise expressly provided, all financial terms are used as defined under Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and all determinations shall be made in
accordance with GAAP, as applied by the Corporation in the preparation of its periodic reports to stockholders. </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=13,SEQ=23,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=464357,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LI1261A.;17',USER='DMALONE',CD='27-MAR-2001;22:48' -->

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_the_macerich_company_2000_cash__the04023"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE MACERICH COMPANY<BR>  2000 CASH BONUS/RESTRICTED STOCK AND STOCK UNIT AWARD PROGRAM<BR>  UNDER THE 2000 INCENTIVE PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_i_title,_purpose_and_authorized_shares"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_2"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I<BR>  TITLE, PURPOSE AND AUTHORIZED SHARES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;TITLE&nbsp;&nbsp; </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Program shall be known as The Macerich Company 2000 Cash Bonus/Restricted Stock and Stock Unit Award Program under the 2000 Incentive Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;PURPOSE&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of this Program is to promote the success of the Company and the interest of its stockholders by providing an additional means to attract,
motivate, retain and reward key employees, including officers, by providing an opportunity to convert cash bonus opportunities into Restricted Stock and/or Stock Unit Awards, enhancing compensation
deferral opportunities and offering additional incentives to increase stock ownership in the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.3&nbsp;&nbsp;SHARES&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The aggregate number of shares of Common Stock issuable under this Program shall be charged against and subject to the limits on the available shares under the
Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_ii_definitions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE II<BR>  DEFINITIONS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Whenever the following terms are used in this Program they shall have the meaning specified below unless the context clearly indicates to the contrary.
Capitalized terms not otherwise defined shall have the meaning assigned to such terms in the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1&nbsp;BONUS PAYMENT DATE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the date designated by the Committee (upon or after its decisions as to awards) on which
the Cash Bonus is or would otherwise be received by the Participant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.2&nbsp;CASH BONUS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an incentive award granted by the Committee, whether or not under the terms of the Plan, that but
for elections under this Program would be paid solely in cash. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.3&nbsp;CONVERSION AMOUNT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the dollar equivalent of the Cash Bonus elected by the Participant to be converted to a
Restricted Stock and/or Stock Unit Award under this Program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.4&nbsp;DIVIDEND EQUIVALENT RIGHT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the amount of cash dividends or other cash distributions paid by the Company on that
number of shares of Common Stock equal to the number of Stock Units credited to a Participant's Stock Unit Account as of the applicable record date for the dividend or other distribution, which amount
shall, at the discretion of the Committee, either be paid on the applicable dividend payment date directly to the Participant in cash or credited in the form of additional Stock Units to the Stock
Unit Account of the Participant, as provided in the applicable Stock Unit Award Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.5&nbsp;EFFECTIVE DATE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means November&nbsp;9, 2000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.6&nbsp;ELIGIBLE EMPLOYEE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any officer or key employee of the Company or a Subsidiary who earns an annual base salary
of at least $100,000 and who otherwise qualifies as a member of a select group of management or highly compensated employees, as described in Sections 201, 301 and 401 of the Employee Retirement
Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, who has been designated by the Committee as potentially eligible to receive a Restricted Stock and/or Stock Unit Award under this Program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.7&nbsp;PARTICIPANT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means any Eligible Employee who has delivered to the Company an election agreement electing to
participate in the Program. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=24,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=715541,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LJ1261A.;10',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->
<A NAME="page_lj1261_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.8&nbsp;PLAN</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means The Macerich Company 2000 Incentive Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.9&nbsp;PROGRAM</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means this The Macerich Company 2000 Cash Bonus/Restricted Stock and Stock Unit Award Program under the 2000
Incentive Plan, as from time to time amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.10&nbsp;RESTRICTED STOCK</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means shares of Common Stock awarded to a Participant pursuant to Article&nbsp;IV of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.11&nbsp;RESTRICTED STOCK AWARD</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an award of Restricted Stock granted by the Committee under the Plan based on the
Conversion Amount. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.12&nbsp;RESTRICTED STOCK AWARD AGREEMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an agreement substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;B (as from time to
time revised by the Committee). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.13&nbsp;STOCK UNIT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a non-voting unit of measurement which is deemed solely for bookkeeping purposes to be
equivalent to one outstanding share of Common Stock (subject to adjustment) awarded to a Participant pursuant to Article&nbsp;IV of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.14&nbsp;STOCK UNIT AWARD</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an award of Stock Units granted by the Committee under the Plan based on the Conversion
Amount. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.15&nbsp;STOCK UNIT AWARD AGREEMENT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an agreement substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;C (as from time to time
revised by the Committee). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.16&nbsp;STOCK UNIT ACCOUNT</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the bookkeeping account maintained by the Company on behalf of each Participant which is
credited with Stock Units calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.4. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.17&nbsp;YEAR</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the applicable calendar year. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_iii_participation"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE III<BR>  PARTICIPATION    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Eligible Employee designated by the Committee for any Year may elect in advance to receive all or part (in increments and on forms authorized by the
Committee) of any Cash Bonus that may be granted in the future in the form of Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units to the extent provided in Article&nbsp;IV. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_iv_restricted_s__lj102349"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV<BR>  RESTRICTED STOCK, STOCK UNIT OR CASH ELECTIONS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;TIME AND TYPES OF ELECTIONS&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On or before September&nbsp;30 of each Year, each Eligible Employee may make an irrevocable election to receive a percentage of Cash Bonus that may be
granted to the Eligible Employee during the following Year in shares of Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units; provided, that any timely election made under the Company's 1999 Cash Bonus/Restricted
Stock and Stock Unit Award Program with respect to any Cash Bonus to be paid in 2001 shall be deemed to be the irrevocable election required to be made under this Program for such Cash Bonus. This
election shall become effective only if the Committee, in authorizing the Cash Bonus, expressly recognizes such alternative payment opportunity in Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units and grants the
Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units at that time. The Committee will have the sole discretion to determine whether Restricted Stock or Stock Units will be issuable. A person who first becomes an
Eligible Employee after the applicable deadline may, within 30&nbsp;days of becoming and being designated as an Eligible Employee, make an irrevocable election to receive any Cash Bonuses granted
for the applicable Year (or remaining portion thereof, as the case may be) in Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=25,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=779743,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LJ1261A.;10',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->
<A NAME="page_lj1261_1_3"> </A>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;ELECTION PROCEDURES&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The elections shall be made in writing on forms provided by the Company and authorized by the Committee. These forms shall take the form of the Election
Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;A, as from time to time amended by the Committee. Neither the distribution nor completion of election agreements shall convey any right to receive a bonus,
in cash, Restricted Stock or Stock Units. Failure to timely elect Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units, however, will result in the payment in cash if any cash bonus is awarded. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.3&nbsp;&nbsp;DISTRIBUTION OF BENEFITS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)&nbsp;TIME AND MANNER OF DISTRIBUTION.&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant shall be entitled to receive a number of unrestricted shares of Restricted
Stock, or to receive a number of shares of Common Stock equal to the number of Stock Units allocated to his or her Stock Unit Account, in accordance with the vesting schedule set forth in the
applicable Restricted Stock Award Agreement or Stock Unit Award Agreement. Alternatively, the Committee may permit a Participant to elect to receive a distribution of shares of Common Stock in an
amount equal to the number of Stock Units, if any, allocated to his or her Stock Unit Account at such time and in such manner as set forth in the form of agreement approved by the Committee. If the
Committee so provides, a Participant may elect any of the distribution commencement dates and methods of distribution (lump sum or annual installments) set forth in the form of agreement approved by
the Committee. </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>CHANGE
IN TIME OR MANNER OF DISTRIBUTION OF STOCK UNITS. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;To
the extent permitted by the Committee and set forth in any applicable Distribution Election Agreement, a Participant may change the manner of any distribution
election from a lump sum to annual installments (or vice versa) made with respect to Stock Units credited under any Stock Unit Account by filing a written election with the Committee on a form
provided by the Committee; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that no such election shall be effective until 12&nbsp;months after such election is filed with the
Committee, and no such election shall be effective if it is made with respect to any Stock Unit Account after benefits with respect to such Stock Unit Account have commenced. An election made pursuant
to this Section&nbsp;4.3(b) shall not affect the date of the commencement of benefits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;To
the extent permitted by the Committee and set forth in any applicable Distribution Election Agreement, a Participant may elect to further defer the commencement
of any distribution to be made
with respect to Stock Units credited under any Stock Unit Account by filing a new written election with the Committee on a form approved by the Committee; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided,
however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that (A)&nbsp;no such election shall be effective until 12&nbsp;months after such election is filed with the Committee, (B)&nbsp;no such new election shall be
effective with respect to any Stock Unit Account after benefits with respect to such Stock Unit Account shall have commenced, and (C)&nbsp;no more than three new elections shall be valid as to any
Stock Unit Account. An election made pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(2) shall not affect the manner of distribution (</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>i.e.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, lump sum versus
installments), the terms of which shall be subject to Section&nbsp;4.3(b)(1) above. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.4&nbsp;&nbsp;NUMBER OF SHARES/STOCK UNITS&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The number of shares of Restricted Stock to be granted and/or the number of Stock Units to be credited under this Program shall equal a multiple of the
Conversion Amount divided by the Fair Market Value of a share of Common Stock (without regard to any restriction) on the applicable Bonus Payment Date. The multiple shall not be changed as to any
election after it is duly made under the terms of this Program without the consent of the Participant. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
multiple for bonuses paid in 2002 and until changed by the Committee shall be 1.5. For example, assume that prior to September&nbsp;30, 2001, a Participant elects to receive 40%
of any cash </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=26,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=241843,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LJ1261A.;10',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->
<A NAME="page_lj1261_1_4"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
bonus in Restricted Stock or Stock Units and, on March&nbsp;31, 2002, the Company grants him a $40,000 cash bonus. The market value of a share of Common Stock on the Bonus Payment Date is $20. The
Participant will receive $24,000 in cash and, at the election of the Committee, 1,200 shares of Restricted Stock or 1,200 Stock Units. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.5&nbsp;&nbsp;NO FRACTIONAL SHARE INTERESTS&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If an election would result in the issuance of a fractional share, the amount of Restricted Stock and/or Stock Units granted shall be rounded down to the next
whole share and the cash alternative amount in lieu of the fractional interest shall be paid in cash. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_v_restricted_stock_awards"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE V<BR>  RESTRICTED STOCK AWARDS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The grant of Restricted Stock Awards, including, but not limited to, the terms of grant, conditions and restrictions, the consideration (other than services)
to be paid, dividend rights, vesting terms, provisions for redelivery to the Company, and adjustments in case of changes in the Common Stock, shall be governed by the terms of the Plan, the Program
and of the Restricted Stock Award Agreement, substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;B (as from time to time revised by the Committee), to be executed and delivered by the Company and the
Participant. After an election is made, the form of the Restricted Stock Award Agreement (if applicable) may not be changed in any manner materially adverse to the Participant without his or her
consent. All Restricted Stock Awards are subject to express prior authorization by the Committee of the terms of the Restricted Stock Award and the specific number of shares of Restricted Stock
thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_vi_stock_unit_awards"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_7"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VI<BR>  STOCK UNIT AWARDS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The grant of Stock Unit Awards, including, but not limited to, the terms of grant, conditions and restrictions, the consideration (other than services) to be
paid, the form and content of Dividend Equivalent rights, vesting terms, and adjustments in case of changes in the Common Stock, shall be governed by the terms of the Plan, the Program and of the
Stock Unit Award Agreement, substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;C (as from time to time revised by the Committee), to be executed and delivered by the Company and the Participant. After an
election is made, the form of the Stock Unit Award Agreement (if applicable) may not be changed in any manner materially adverse to the Participant without his or her consent. All Stock Unit Awards
are subject to express prior authorization by the Committee of the terms of the Stock Unit Award and the specific number of shares of Common Stock referenced in the Participant's Stock Unit Account
thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_vii_administration"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_8"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VII<BR>  ADMINISTRATION    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;RIGHTS AND DUTIES.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Program shall be administered by and all Restricted Stock and Stock Unit Awards to Eligible Employees shall be authorized by the Committee. The Committee
shall have all powers necessary to accomplish those purposes, including, but not by way of limitation, the following: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;to
determine the particular Eligible Employees who will receive Cash Bonuses, the extent to which and price at which a Cash Bonus may be settled in shares of Common
Stock, Restricted Stock or Stock Units, and the other specific terms and conditions of Restricted Stock and Stock Unit Awards consistent with the express limits of this Program and the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=27,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=285254,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LJ1261B.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->
<A NAME="page_lj1261_1_5"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;to approve from time to time the election agreement and other forms of Restricted Stock and Stock Unit Award Agreements (which need not be identical either as to
type of award or among Participants or from year to year); and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;to
resolve any questions concerning benefits payable to a Participant and make all other determinations and take such other action as contemplated by this Program
or the Plan or as may be necessary or advisable for the administration or interpretation of this Program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>7.2&nbsp;&nbsp;CLAIMS PROCEDURES.&nbsp;&nbsp; </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent the Committee permits deferral elections extending to the termination of employment or beyond, the following claims procedures shall apply: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The
Committee shall notify Participants and, where appropriate, the Beneficiary(ies) of their right to claim benefits under these claims procedures, shall make
forms available for filing of such claims, and shall provide the name of the person or persons with whom such claims should be filed. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The
Committee shall act upon claims as required and communicate a decision to the claimant promptly and, in any event, not later than 90&nbsp;days after the claim
is received by the Committee, unless special circumstances require an extension of time for processing the claim. If an extension is required, notice of the extension shall be furnished to the
claimant prior to the end of the initial 90-day period, which notice shall indicate the reasons for the extension and the expected decision date. The extension
shall not exceed 90&nbsp;days. The claim may be deemed by the claimant to have been denied for purposes of further review described below in the event a decision is not furnished to the claimant
within the period described in the preceding three sentences. Every claim for benefits which is denied shall be denied by written notice setting forth in a manner calculated to be understood by the
claimant (i)&nbsp;the specific reason or reasons for the denial, (ii)&nbsp;specific reference to any provisions of this Program on which denial is based, (iii)&nbsp;description of any additional
material or information necessary for the claimant to perfect his claim with an explanation of why such material or information is necessary, and (iv)&nbsp;an explanation of the procedure for
further review of the denial of the claim under this Program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;The
claimant or his or her duly authorized representative shall have 60&nbsp;days after receipt of denial of his or her claim to request a review of such denial,
the right to review all pertinent documents and the right to submit issues and comments in writing. Upon receipt of a request for a review of the denial of a benefit claim, the Committee shall
undertake a full and fair review of the denial. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;The
Committee shall issue a decision not later than 60&nbsp;days after receipt of a request for review from a claimant unless special circumstances, such as the
need to hold a hearing, require a longer period of time, in which case a decision shall be rendered as soon as possible but not later than 120&nbsp;days after receipt of the claimant's request for
review. The decision on review shall be in writing and shall include specific reasons for the decision written in a manner calculated to be understood by the claimant with specific reference to any
provisions of this Program on which the decision is based. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lj1261_article_viii_miscellaneous"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lj1261_9"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VIII<BR>  MISCELLANEOUS    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;INCORPORATION BY REFERENCE&nbsp;&nbsp; </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except where in conflict with the express terms of this Program, the terms of the Plan govern the Program and are incorporated by reference, including, without
limitation, the following: the administrative powers and authority of the Committee and the effect of its decisions; the unfunded status of benefits; provisions for non-transferability of
rights; rights (or absence of rights) of eligible persons, participants, and beneficiaries; compliance with laws; tax withholding obligation of Participants; privileges of stock ownership; and
governing law/construction/severability. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=28,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=4619,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LJ1261B.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->
<A NAME="page_lj1261_1_6"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>8.2&nbsp;&nbsp;AMENDMENT, TERMINATION AND SUSPENSION&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee or the Board may, at any time, terminate or, from time to time, amend, modify or suspend this Program, in whole or in part. No Restricted Stock
or Stock Unit Awards may be granted under this Program during any suspension of this Program or after termination of this Program. Termination or amendment of this Program shall have no effect on any
then outstanding Restricted Stock or Stock Unit Awards. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.3&nbsp;&nbsp;TERM OF THIS PROGRAM&nbsp;&nbsp; </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term of this Program is indefinite, subject to the term of the Plan and Section&nbsp;8.2. All authority of the Committee with respect to Restricted Stock
and Stock Unit Awards hereunder, including its authority to amend a Restricted Stock or Stock Unit Award, shall continue during any suspension of this Program or the Plan, in respect of outstanding
Restricted Stock and Stock Unit Awards on such Termination Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.4&nbsp;&nbsp;NON-EXCLUSIVITY OF PROGRAM&nbsp;&nbsp; </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing in this Program shall limit or be deemed to limit the authority of the Board or the Committee to grant awards or authorize any other compensation, with
or without reference to the Common Stock, under the Plan or any other plan or authority. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.5&nbsp;&nbsp;RELATIONSHIP TO EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENTS&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of any Participant who has an employment agreement with the Company, the Conversion Amount reflected by a Restricted Stock or Stock Unit Award
shall not be, but any remaining amount paid as a Cash Bonus shall be, considered a bonus paid in the applicable Year in which it is paid. The consequences of a termination of service, whether before
or after a Change in Control, in respect of any rights or benefits related to the Conversion Amount shall be governed solely by the terms of the Restricted Stock or Stock Unit Award. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=29,EFW="2042811",CP="THE MACERICH COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=54314,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK033:[01WLA1.01WLA1261]LJ1261B.;7',USER='TOSBORNA',CD='27-MAR-2001;10:17' -->

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;A<BR>
Election Form</B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lk1261_the_macerich_company_irrevocab__the05934"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lk1261_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE MACERICH COMPANY<BR>  IRREVOCABLE ELECTION AGREEMENT<BR>  <BR>    2000 CASH BONUS/RESTRICTED STOCK AND STOCK UNIT AWARD PROGRAM UNDER<BR>  THE MACERICH COMPANY 2000 INCENTIVE PLAN    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>IF DURING THE YEAR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE GRANTS A CASH BONUS TO ME UNDER THE PROGRAM AND IF THE COMPENSATION
COMMITTEE THEN EXPRESSLY AUTHORIZES ME TO RECEIVE ALL OR PART OF THE CASH BONUS IN THE FORM OF A RESTRICTED STOCK OR STOCK UNIT AWARD (A "STOCK-BASED AWARD"):</B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>I IRREVOCABLY ELECT TO TAKE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;% OF MY CASH BONUS IN THE FORM OF A STOCK-BASED AWARD. I UNDERSTAND THE COMMITTEE HAS THE SOLE DISCRETION TO
DETERMINE IF THE STOCK-BASED AWARD IS IN THE FORM OF RESTRICTED STOCK OR STOCK UNITS.</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>I UNDERSTAND THAT:  </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE CONVERSION RATE, OR "MULTIPLE", FOR PURPOSES OF OR IN RESPECT OF DETERMINING THE NUMBER OF SHARES UNDERLYING THE AWARD WILL BE
1.5</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE VESTING SCHEDULE FOR THE STOCK-BASED AWARD WILL BE NOT LESS THAN AT A RATE OF 20% PER YEAR.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS ELECTION IS IRREVOCABLE AND MUST BE FILED BY SEPTEMBER 30,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WITH:</B></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>RICHARD A. BAYER, GENERAL COUNSEL<BR>
401 WILSHIRE BOULEVARD, SUITE 700<BR>
SANTA MONICA, CALIFORNIA 90401</B></FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>IF THIS ELECTION IS NOT TIMELY FILED, I WILL NOT HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM FOR THE YEAR
2000.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS ELECTION IS SUBJECT TO THE TERMS OF THE PROGRAM, THE PLAN (INCLUDING THE INDIVIDUAL SHARE AWARD LIMITS) AND THE APPLICABLE
STOCK-BASED AWARD AGREEMENT.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS ELECTION DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A GUARANTEE THAT I WILL RECEIVE ANY BONUS FROM THE COMPANY.</B></FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>ACKNOWLEDGMENT AND AGREEMENT  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>I acknowledge and agree to the foregoing terms of this Election Agreement.  </B></FONT></P>
